questions.Question: Ventilators are provided near the ceiling of the room because
questions.optionA: The exhaled warmer air rises up and goes out
questions.optionB: These provide cross ventilation in the room
questions.optionC: These provide some sunlight in the room
questions.optionD: These do not look nice in the lower part
questions.solution: Solution:		Ventilators are provided near ceilings in the rooms of our houses because the air we breathe out is warm and rises out of the room through the ventilators. Cool fresh air rushes into the room through the doors and windows.

questions.Question: Wollen clothes keep the body warm because
questions.optionA: Wool increases the temperature of the body
questions.optionC: Wool absorbs radiant heat from outer objects
questions.optionD: Wool rejects heat from the outer objects
questions.solution: Solution:		Wool does not allow heat to pass on from body to surrounding because it is a bad conductor of heat. So, the body is kept warm.

questions.Question: Plants are dried up in winter due to frost because
questions.optionB: Photosynthesis does not take place at such low temperature
questions.optionC: Respiration does not take place at low temperature
questions.optionD: There is mechanical loss of tissues and drought condition prevails
questions.solution: Solution:		The rate of respiration is dependent on temperature: The warmer it is, the more a plant will respire. Extreme winter cold and frost are similar to summer drought in that frozen water is unavailable to the plant. The air is very dry as well.

questions.Question: A cup of hot coffee is placed on a metal table in a room. By which of the following methods does it lose heat?
questions.solution: Solution:		A cup of hot coffee is placed on a metal table in a room can lose heat via conduction, convection and radiation.

questions.Question: In general, which is the cause of a land breeze?
questions.solution: Solution:		Temperature is the cause of land breeze in general.

questions.Question: A mirage occurs because of
questions.optionB: Total internal reflection by layers of air
questions.solution: Solution:		A mirage occurs because of total internal reflection by layers of air.

questions.Question: Optical fibres are based on the phenomenon of
questions.solution: Solution:		Optical fibers operate based on the principle of total internal reflection phenomenon that occurs at the interface between the core and the cladding provided that the angle of the incident light inside the core is higher than the angle called critical angle.

questions.Question: The angle between the ________ and the incident ray is called the angle of incidence.
questions.solution: Solution:		The normal line divides the angle between the incident ray and the reflected ray into two equal angles. The angle between the incident ray and the normal is known as the angle of incidence. The angle between the reflected ray and the normal is known as the angle of reflection.

questions.Question: A periscope works by the principle of
questions.solution: Solution:		A periscope works by the principle of total internal reflection.

questions.Question: A periscope works on the principle of
questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: When a ring of metal is heated what happens to its hole ?
questions.optionC: It expands or contracts according to its diameter
questions.optionD: It expands or contracts according to its coefficient of expansion
questions.solution: Solution:		The hole size will increase because in expansion the size between two molecules do not increase so when the molecules on the outer edge move outward. Due to expansion, the size of the hole will also increase so as to compensate the distance change between the molecules.

questions.Question: The earth is a
questions.optionC: Good absorber and good radiator of heat
questions.optionD: Bad absorber and bad radiator of heat
questions.solution: Solution:		The earth is a good absorber and good radiator of heat.

questions.Question: When temperature difference between liquid and its surroundings is doubled, the rate of loss of heat will:
questions.solution: Solution:		According to Newton’s law of cooling, the rate of loss of heat of a body is directly proportional to the difference between the temperature of hot body and temperature of the surroundings, provided that the difference in temperature is small enough.

questions.Question: The word ''insolation' means
questions.solution: Solution:		The word ''insolation' means incoming solar radiation.

questions.Question: Tap water is placed in an open pad and allowed to evaporate. After some time the temperature of water
questions.solution: Solution:		Tap water is placed in an open pad and allowed to evaporate. After some time the temperature of water decreases slightly.

questions.Question: A man stands in a lift which accelerates upwards. The resultant reaction force on the floor of the lift is
questions.optionA: Greater than the weight of the man
questions.optionB: Less than the weight of the man
questions.optionC: Same as the weight of the man
questions.solution: Solution:		The weight of the man mg is acting on the floor. As the lift is moving up with an acceleration, say a, the man too in it is having this acceleration. The force producing this acceleration is ma. By Newton's third law, this force will have an equal reaction pressing the floor equal to ma. Therefore the total resultant reaction on the floor is mg+ma = m(g+a) which is mg, the weight of the man. So (a) is correct.

questions.Question: Who defined the law of gravitation ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Isaac Newton put forward the law in 1687 and used it to explain the observed motions of the planets and their moons, which had been reduced to mathematical form by Johannes Kepler early in the 17th century.

questions.Question: It is difficult to fix a nail on a freely suspended wooden frame. Which law supports this statement?
questions.solution: Solution:		Newton's third law supports this statement. When the wooden block is not resting against a support, the block and nails both move forward on being hit with a hammer. However, when the block is held firmly against a support, and the nail is hit, an equal reaction of the support drives the nail into the block.

questions.Question: In the Earth, the weight of a body is maximum at the
questions.solution: Solution:		Since weight of the body is directly proportional to g, the weight of the body is maximum at the centre of the earth and zero at the centre of the earth.

questions.Question: A person is hurt on kicking a stone due to
questions.solution: Solution:		Newton’s third law states that “For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction.” The statement means that in every interaction, there is a pair of forces acting on the two interacting objects. The size of the forces on the first object equals the size of the force on the second object. The direction of the force on the first object is opposite to the direction of the force on the second object. So harder the stone is kicked, the harder will be its effect on the hitter.

questions.Question: Supersonic plane fly with the speed
questions.optionA: less than the speed of sound
questions.optionC: greater than the speed of sound
questions.solution: Solution:		Vehicles that fly at supersonic speeds are flying faster than the speed of sound.

questions.Question: Mach number is used in connection with the speed of
questions.solution: Solution:		Mach number is used in connection with the speed of aircraft.

questions.Question: On a stationary sail boat, air is blown from a fan attached to the boat. The boat
questions.optionA: moves in opposite direction in which the air is blown
questions.optionC: moves in the same direction in which air blows
questions.solution: Solution:		In this case air blown by the fan will try to push the sail boat in a certain direction. But at the same time due to Newton's third law of motion the fan will experience a force due to the air blown in a direction opposite to the direction in which the sail boat will experience the force due to the blown air. So, as a whole the system will be at rest and it will not move.

questions.Question: Rainbow is due to
questions.optionA: absorption of sunlight in minute water droplets
questions.optionB: diffusion of sunlight through water droplets
questions.optionD: refraction and reflection of sunlight by water droplets
questions.solution: Solution:		A rainbow is a meteorological phenomenon that is caused by reflection, refraction and dispersion of light in water droplets resulting in a spectrum of light appearing in the sky. It takes the form of a multicoloured circular arc. Rainbows caused by sunlight always appear in the section of sky directly opposite the sun.

questions.Question: Stars which appear single to the naked eye but are double when seen through a telescope are
questions.solution: Solution:		They are single to naked eye because they are far from us. But, if we see with telescope We can observe that there are two or double stars.

questions.Question: Tungsten is used for the manufacture of the filament of an electric bulb, because
questions.optionD: It has a very high melting point
questions.solution: Solution:		Tungsten is used in electric bulb because it has high melting point and it does not oxidize. Thus tungsten filament does not melt even when a large amount of heat is produced due to passage of current through the filament (via heating effect of current).

questions.Question: In a filament type light bulb most of the electric power consumed appears as
questions.solution: Solution:		In a filament type light bulb most of the electric power consumed appears as Infra-red rays. When electricity flows through the fiber, it heats up. Depending on the filament temperature, the radiation is emitted from the filament.

questions.Question: Which of the following metals is used for the manufacture of heating elements provided in electric iron ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Nichrome is the most common domestic heating element and is found in many household products. Commonly, items such as toasters, hair dryers and heaters use Nichrome coils to pass electricity and give off heat. Nichrome is made of 80 percent nickel and 20 percent chromium, and its high melting point of 1,400 degrees Celsius. Nichrome is a non-magnetic alloy of nickel, chromium, and often iron, usually used as a resistance wire. Patented in 1905, it is the oldest documented form of resistance heating alloy. A common alloy is 80% nickel and 20% chromium, by mass, but there are many others to accommodate various applications. Due to its relatively high electrical resistivity and resistance to oxidation at high temperatures, it is widely used in electric heating elements, such as in hair dryers, electric ovens, soldering iron, toasters, and even electronic cigarettes.

questions.Question: When an electric bulb breaks, there is an explosive sound. That is due to
questions.optionA: The chemical reaction between the gases inside the bulb
questions.optionB: The compressed gases inside rushing out suddenly
questions.optionC: The air outside rushing in to fill the vacuum inside the bulb
questions.solution: Solution:		The inside of the bulb being a vacuum, the outside air rushes in when the bulb is broken. The vibrations of the rushing air molecules produce the sound.

questions.Question: Flemings ''Left hand Rule" is associated with the effect of
questions.solution: Solution:		Flemings ''Left hand Rule" is associated with the effect of magnetic field on current.

questions.Question: The base of an electric iron is brightly polished mainly
questions.optionA: To make it smooth and frictionless
questions.optionC: To reduce heat loss by radiation
questions.solution: Solution:		Polished surfaces are poor radiators of heat. So loss of heat on that account is reduced and the electric iron remains hotter than otherwise.

questions.Question: A stone floor feels cold to the bare feet but a carpet on the same floor feels warm. This is because
questions.optionA: The floor and carpet are at different temperatures
questions.optionB: The stone conveys the heat away from the feet more rapidly than the carpet
questions.optionC: The carpet is a better conductor of heat than the stone
questions.optionD: The human body maintains a constant temperature
questions.solution: Solution:		Both the floor and the carpet have the same temperature as both are exposed to the same atmosphere. So the feet losing more heat, the floor appears cooler to the feet.

questions.Question: Global warming is expected to result in
questions.solution: Solution:		Global warming is expected to result in increase in level of sea, change in crop pattern and change in coast line.

questions.Question: Why two thin shirts can keep us warmer than a single thick shirt in winter ?
questions.optionA: Two thin shirts become thicker so prevent transmission of heat
questions.optionB: Air layer between two shirts works as good conductor
questions.optionC: Air layer between two shirts behaves like insulating media
questions.optionD: No radiation of heat takes place
questions.solution: Solution:		Two thin shirts can keep us warmer than a single thick shirt in winter because of the air that is trapped between the two thin shirts. This air acts as an insulator and ensures that heat does not escape.

questions.Question: Sun's heat reaches us by
questions.solution: Solution:		Sun's heat reaches us by radiation.

questions.Question: Which of these liquids has the highest viscosity?
questions.solution: Solution:		Syrup has the highest viscosity.

questions.Question: The absorption of ink by blotting paper involves
questions.optionB: Diffusion of ink through the blotting
questions.solution: Solution:		The absorption of ink by blotting paper involves capillary action phenomenon because the blotting paper is a thin and a smooth paper which allows a little thicker liquids like ink to absorb.

questions.Question: Water from soil enters into the root hairs owing to :
questions.solution: Solution:		In plants, the transpiration stream is the uninterrupted stream of water, and other, which is taken up by the roots and, via the xylem vessels, transported to the leaves where it will eventually evaporate into the air/apoplast-interface of the substomatal cavity. It is driven in by capillary action and in some plants root pressure. The main driving factor is the difference in water potential between the soil and the substomatal cavity caused by transpiration.

questions.Question: Which of the following liquids has the least density ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Gasoline or petrol is a transparent, petroleum derived liquid that is used primarily as a fuel in internal combustion engines. It consists mostly of organic compounds obtained by the fractional distillation of petroleum, enhanced with a variety of additives. The specific gravity (or relative density) of gasoline ranges from 0.71–0.77 kg/l (719.7 kg/m3 ; 0.026 lb/m3; 6.073 lb/US gal; 7.29 lb/imp gal), higher densities having a greater volume of aromatics. Gasoline floats on water; water cannot generally be used to extinguish a gasoline fire, unless used in a fine mist.

questions.Question: A small drop of oil spreads over water because :
questions.optionA: Oil has a higher surface tension
questions.optionB: Water has a higher surface tension
questions.solution: Solution:		Surface tension of oil is smaller than that of water. When oil is dropped on the surface of water, the force stretches the oil drops on all sides. Hence the oil spreads over the surface of water.

questions.Question: If an electron and a photon have the same wavelength, then they will have the same
questions.solution: Solution:		When a non-relativistic electron and a non-relativistic proton are moving and have the same de Broglie wavelength, then they will have the same linear momentum p = mv. If the electron and proton have the same momentum, they cannot have the same speed because of the difference in their masses. An electron and photon can have the same wavelength since the wavelength of electron can be changed by changing its velocity.

questions.Question: A ball is thrown vertically upward from the ground. It crosses a point at the height of 25 m twice at an interval of 4 seconds. The ball was thrown with the velocity of
questions.solution: Solution:		The interval between object pass the same point is 4 sec.That means in 2 sec, object reaches the top and in next 2 sec, it again reaches the same point.By the info given, we can find the velocity of that point by using : v=u+(-gt)0= u - 10×2u = 20Then the velocity at 25m is 20m/sec.so the initial velocity is −v2 = u2 + (−2gh) 400 = u2 − 2x 10 x 25 u2 = 900=> u = 30 m/s

questions.Question: Rain drops fall from great height. Which among the following statements is true regarding it?
questions.optionA: They fall with that ultimate velocity, which are different for different droplets
questions.optionB: They fall with same ultimate velocity
questions.optionC: Their velocity increases and they fall with different velocity on the earth
questions.optionD: Their velocity increases and they fall with same velocity on the earth
questions.solution: Solution:		Any mass is attracted to the Earth by the pull of gravity. Gravity accelerates all objects towards the ground at a specific rate. Without any other forces present, the speed of an object in free fall will increase the farther or longer it falls. In general the air resistance on an object depends upon several variables. First, it depends upon the shape of the object. Its shape determines the object’s drag coefficient: the more aerodynamic the shape, the less drag. Second, it depends upon the size of the object; specifically the cross-sectional area presented to the airflow (perpendicular to the direction of travel). And lastly, it depends upon the speed of the object. At low speeds the object’s resistance is directly proportional to speed, and at higher speeds the object’s resistance is proportional to its speed squared. Most objects falling through the air would be considered to be moving at a higher speed, even though that speed might not be great compared to some velocities.

questions.Question: A particle dropped from the top of a tower uniformly falls on ground at a distance which is equal to the height of tower. Which of the following paths will be traversed by the particle ?
questions.solution: Solution:		If a particle dropped from the top of a tower uniformly falls on ground at a distance which is equal to the height of tower then a parabolic path will be traversed by a particle because when the particle is dropped that point is called the point of projection and when it reaches the ground that point is called the point of impact. Now, if the two points is met with one another the curve emerges is parabolic in nature. Hence, we can say that the path followed by the particle is of parabolic trajectories.

questions.Question: A particle is thrown vertically upward. When it reaches the highest point, it has
questions.solution: Solution:		When a particle is thrown vertically upwards in space, it will experience constant acceleration towards the ground (irrespective of the direction in which it is moving in), known as acceleration due to gravity. At the highest point, it has zero velocity but has downward acceleration equal to acceleration due to gravity.

questions.Question: Which one of the following processes is responsible for the glittering of air bubble rising through water?
questions.solution: Solution:		Total internal reflection is responsible for glittering which occurs when the light from a denser media (liquid) tries to enter less dense media (air in bubble). This reflected light when captured by our eyes is seen as glittering.

questions.Question: The increasing order of the refractive index of certain materials is (left to right) ________
questions.solution: Solution:		The increasing order of the refractive index of certain materials is (left to right) Ice, Kerosene, Benzene, Rock Salt.

questions.Question: Which color deviates least when passing through a Prism
questions.solution: Solution:		Red light suffers the least amount of deviation and violet the most. When a white light is made to pass through a prism, formation of a spectrum of seven colors occurs showing white light is a combination of seven separate colors.

questions.Question: Which color deviates highest when passing through a Prism
questions.solution: Solution:		The wavelength and frequency of these deviated colours is different, they deviate differently at different angles due to the velocity difference of the prism. The colour red therefore deviates the least since it has maximum wavelength and colour violet deviates the most since it has the least wavelength.

questions.Question: A pond of water appears less deep due to
questions.solution: Solution:		The apparent depth will look less that its real depth due to the refraction of light. First of all, imagine an object at the bottom of the pond, emitting three beams of light: one straight to the centre of your eye, one above your eye, and one below. Now, as light travels faster in air than it does in water, it will accelerate as it breaks the surface, at which point it bends away from the ‘normal’ - the imaginary line perpendicular to the surface. So back to those three beams, the one coming straight at your eye, and as such perfectly vertical, will not bend one way or another as it leaves the water. The other two beams, however, will bend further away from that middle beam, creating a ‘triangle’ with a larger base, if you were to draw a diagram. These new trajectories, if traced backwards, and ignoring a reverse bending in water, will all meet at a new point, higher than the actual point of origin.

questions.Question: While catching a ball, a player pulls down his hands to lower the–
questions.solution: Solution:		A cricketer lowers his hands while taking a catch to decrease the rate of momentum. Cricketers increase the time by pulling their hand's backward with the ball while taking a catch. Linear momentum or translational momentum is the product of the mass and velocity of an object.

questions.Question: Momentum is measured as the product of :
questions.solution: Solution:		The unit of momentum is the product of the units of mass and velocity.

questions.Question: Two stones of different masses are dropped simultaneously from the top of a building
questions.optionA: Smaller stone reaches the ground earlier
questions.optionB: Larger stone reaches the ground earlier
questions.optionC: Both the stones reach the ground at the same time
questions.optionD: Depends on the composition of the stone
questions.solution: Solution:		Both stones reach the ground at the same time. The initial speed is 0 for both stones, and the only acceleration working in that system would be g (Gravity acceleration). So, as the distance is the same, the final speed will be the same time. The only reason which could change this result is a difference in the shape of the stones. While they fall to the ground, they must “open” a way across the air. The shape of the falling object will decide the force needed to open that way. This is called the “Air resistance”. Depending on the shape of the object, the resistance force will be bigger or smaller. As this force works counter to g, the falling time will decrease. Between a feather and a plumb ball, the falling time will be the same in vacuum, but inside air, the resistance force for the feather has almost the same value than gravity, while for the ball, the resistance is very much weaker than gravity.

questions.Question: A man jumping out of a moving train is thrown
questions.solution: Solution:		When a man jumps out of a moving train, his feet suddenly comes to rest on touching the ground. But, the upper part of the body continues to be in motion and has a tendency to move forward. That is why the person falls with his head forward.

questions.Question: An object at rest will remain at rest and an object in motion will remain in motion until and unless it is acted upon by an external force. This is Newton's
questions.solution: Solution:		An object at rest will remain at rest and an object in motion will remain in motion until and unless it is acted upon by an external force. This is Newton's first law of motion.

questions.Question: What is the minimum escape velocity of rocket to be launched into space ?
questions.solution: Solution:		A spacecraft leaving the surface of Earth, for example, needs to be going about 11 kilometers (7 miles) per second, or over 40,000 kilometers per hour (25,000 miles per hour), to enter orbit. Achieving escape velocity is one of the biggest challenges facing space travel.

questions.Question: The period of revolution of a geostationary satellite is
questions.solution: Solution:		The period of revolution of a geostationary satellite is 24 hours.

questions.Question: The laws which govern the motion of planets are called ________
questions.solution: Solution:		Johannes Kepler was a 16th century astronomer who established three laws which govern the motion of planets around the sun. These are known as Kepler's laws of planetary motion.

questions.Question: Who gave the Theory of Relativity?
questions.solution: Solution:		In 1905, Albert Einstein determined that the laws of physics are the same for all non-accelerating observers, and that the speed of light in a vacuum was independent of the motion of all observers. This was the theory of special relativity.

questions.Question: What is the minimum velocity required for a rocket to overcome earth's gravity and travel into space?
questions.solution: Solution:		The minimum velocity required for a rocket to overcome earth's gravity and travel into space is 11.2 km/sec.

questions.Question: A disk and a sphere of same radius but different masses roll on two inclined planes of the same altitude and length. Which one of the two objects gets to the bottom of the plane first ?
questions.optionD: Both reach at the same time
questions.solution: Solution:		The sphere will reach the bottom faster than the disk. It is because the disk has a higher rotational inertia than the solid:I= mr²I is the rotational inertia where m is the mass and r is the square of distance from the axis of rotation. in the case of disk I is greater due to r and more the I, more is the rotational K.E. Then for conservation of energy Translational K.E will be less.mgh= K.E (T) + K.E (R)so in case of sphere translational K.E will be more, meaning more final velocity and it will reach the bottom faster.

questions.Question: The washing machine works on the principle of
questions.solution: Solution:		A washing machine by spinning at 800-1600 rpm helps soap and dirt with it to leave the surface of the cloth via centrifugal force and into outlet pipes hence utilizing centrifugation to both clean and partially dry the clothes loaded in it.

questions.Question: When an unbalanced force acts on an object
questions.optionA: Causes change in motion of the object
questions.optionB: The speed & direction of the object will change
questions.solution: Solution:		When an unbalanced force acts on an object it causes change in motion of the object, the speed and direction of the object changes and the object moves.

questions.Question: What type of force acts on a car moving around a curve?
questions.solution: Solution:		As a car makes a turn, the force of friction acting upon the turned wheels of the car provides centripetal force required for circular motion. As a bucket of water is tied to a string and spun in a circle, the tension force acting upon the bucket provides the centripetal force required for circular motion.

questions.Question: Damp clothes are dried in spin dryers by the action of
questions.solution: Solution:		The spin dryer is probably the most familiar centrifuge. The spin dryer of a washing machine removes excess water from the clothing by rotating at a high speed. The high speed of rotation creates a high centrifugal force for the water in the clothing which causes it to be pulled to the outside of the spinning portion of the washing machine and away from the clothes.

questions.Question: Which Color has the Longest Wavelength?
questions.solution: Solution:		Red colour has the longest wavelength.

questions.Question: The colour of sky appears blue due to
questions.solution: Solution:		Gases and particles in Earth's atmosphere scatter sunlight in all directions. Blue light is scattered more than other colors because it travels as shorter, smaller waves.

questions.Question: Sun appears red in colour at sunrise and sunset due to
questions.optionA: The fact that sun emits only red colour at that time
questions.optionB: Red light having longer wave length scatters away
questions.optionC: That sun comes out of the mountains
questions.optionD: That all other colours scatter away except red
questions.solution: Solution:		During sunrise and sunset, the rays have to travel a larger part of the atmosphere because they are very close to the horizon. Therefore, light other than red is mostly scattered away. Most of the red light, which is the least scattered, enters our eyes. Hence, the sun and the sky appear red.

questions.Question: Total number of colours exists in sunlight
questions.solution: Solution:		White light is called as white because it consists of seven colors. The sunlight splits into seven colors namely violet, indigo, blue, green, orange, and red. We usually call it as VIBGYOR.

questions.Question: When white light passes through a glass prism we get a spectrum on the other side of the prism. In the emergent beam the ray which is deviated least is
questions.solution: Solution:		When white light passes through a glass prism we get a spectrum on the other side of the prism. In the emergent beam the ray which is deviated least is the red ray.

questions.Question: Water cannot be used to extinguish fire caused by electric current, because
questions.solution: Solution:		Using water for putting out electric fires is risky, as the firemen can be electrocuted by the water jet. Water is a good conductor of electricity, and, the electric current flows through the water-jet directly into the hands of the person who is holding the waterhose, resulting in immediate electrocution.

questions.Question: Brightness of bulb depends on voltage or current?
questions.solution: Solution:		Brightness of bulb depends on both voltage and current. The brightness depends on power.Since we know thatPower (P) = Voltage x Current = V ISo whether you increase the current or the voltage the brightness will increase.

questions.Question: The resistance of a conductor is inversely proportional to its:
questions.solution: Solution:		The resistance of a wire is directly proportional to its length and inversely proportional to its cross-sectional area. Resistance also depends on the material of the conductor.

questions.Question: Which one of the following is an ohmic conductor?
questions.solution: Solution:		An ohmic conductor is defined as a two-terminal device in which the voltage or current characteristics have a straight line passing through the origin. Silver, copper wire, metals are the examples of ohmic conductors.

questions.Question: What is the effective resistance (in Ω) of two resistors 20 Ω and 30 Ω connected in parallel?
questions.solution: Solution:		according to rules1/R = 1/R1 + 1/R2 (for parallel)=1/20 + 1/30=12 ohm

questions.Question: Which of the following pairs of physical quantities have the same dimensions?
questions.solution: Solution:		Work and Energy have the same physical quantities.

questions.Question: What is the fundamental unit of amount of a substance?
questions.solution: Solution:		The mole, symbol mol, is the SI unit of amount of substance of a specified elementary entity, which may be an atom, molecule, ion, electron, any other particle or a specified group of such particles; its magnitude is set by fixing the numerical value of the Avogadro constant to be exactly 6.022 141 29 × 1023 when it is expressed in the SI unit mol–1.

questions.Question: The motion of a body that repeats itself after a regular interval of time is
questions.solution: Solution:		A motion that repeats itself after equal intervals of time is known as periodic motion. Examples of periodic motion are a tuning fork or motion of a pendulum if you analyze the motion you will find that the pendulum passes through the mean position only after a definite interval of time.

questions.Question: Negative acceleration is in the opposite direction of:
questions.solution: Solution:		When an object is slowing down, the acceleration is in the opposite direction as the velocity. Thus, this object has a negative acceleration. When an object is speeding up, the acceleration is in the same direction as the velocity. Thus, this object also has a negative acceleration.

questions.Question: If an object moves with constant velocity,
questions.optionC: It must have constant speed in constant direction
questions.solution: Solution:		When an object is moving with constant velocity, it does not change direction nor speed and therefore is represented as a straight line when graphed as distance over time. You can also obtain an object's velocity if you know its trace over time.

questions.Question: When a steel ball is placed on the surface of mercury, it does not sink because
questions.optionA: Of the surface tension of mercury
questions.optionC: Of the high viscosity of mercury
questions.optionD: The density of mercury is greater than that of steel
questions.solution: Solution:		When a steel ball is placed on the surface of mercury, it does not sink because the density of mercury is greater than that of steel.

questions.Question: Clouds float in the atmosphere because of their
questions.solution: Solution:		The key to why clouds float is that the density of the same volume of cloud material is less than the density of the same amount of dry air. Just as oil floats on water because it is less dense, clouds float on air because the moist air in clouds is less dense than dry air.

questions.Question: When a ship enters the sea from a river
questions.optionC: It remains at the same level
questions.optionD: It rises or sinks depending on the material it is made of
questions.solution: Solution:		When a ship enters a sea from a river ,the ship is elevated or uplifted due to the density of sea water and during the buoyant motion of the ship, as it would gain both potential and kinetic energy when rising in the fluid.

questions.Question: The apparent weight of a man in a lift is less the real weight when :
questions.optionA: The lift is going up with an acceleration
questions.optionB: The lift is going down with uniform speed
questions.optionC: The lift is going up with uniform speed
questions.optionD: The lift is going down with an acceleration
questions.solution: Solution:		If the lift accelerates downwards with acceleration a, then the apparent weight of the man standing in the lift will be less than the true weight of the man by an amount ma. On the contrary, if the lift accelerates upwards with acceleration, then the apparent weight of the man will be greater than his true weight.

questions.Question: A balloon filled with hydrogen will
questions.optionB: Reach a particular height and remain floating
questions.optionD: Reach a particular height and start coming down
questions.solution: Solution:		A balloon filled with the hydrogen stops rising after it has attained a certain height in the sky. This is because as height increases, the density of air decreases resulting in a decrease of buoyant force.

questions.Question: Why does ice covered in sawdust not melt quickly ?

questions.optionB: The water is absorbed by sawdust
questions.optionC: Sawdust is a bad conductor of heat
questions.optionD: Sawdust is good conductor of heat
questions.solution: Solution:		Ice packed in sawdust does not melt quickly because it provides insulation.

questions.Question: Ice is packed in saw dust because
questions.optionA: Saw dust will not get melted easily.
questions.optionB: Saw dust is poor conductor of heat.
questions.optionC: Saw dust is a good conductor of heat.
questions.optionD: Saw dust does not stick to the ice.
questions.solution: Solution:		Ice packed in sawdust does not melt quickly because it provides insulation.

questions.Question: In general, which is the cause of a sea breeze?
questions.solution: Solution:		The usual cause of sea breeze is the difference in specific heat capacity between land and water Land heats and cools more quickly than water.

questions.Question: Outside of cooking utensils are generally left black from below because
questions.optionA: It is difficult to clean daily.
questions.optionB: Black surface is a good conductor of heat.
questions.optionC: Black surface is a poor conductor of heat.
questions.optionD: Black surface is a good absorber of heat.
questions.solution: Solution:		The outside surface of a utensil used for heating is coated black so that it may absorb more heat and make heating quicker. This is because black surface is a good absorber of heat.

questions.Question: Heat transfer by radiation mainly depends upon
questions.optionA: Kind and extent of its surface
questions.solution: Solution:		Heat transfer by radiation depends upon all of the above.

questions.Question: The intensity ratio of waves is 25 : 9. What is the ratio of their amplitudes?
questions.solution: Solution:		In general, the intensity of a wave is proportional to the square of its amplitude. This has an important implication: relative intensity can be obtained by squaring relative amplitude. I α a2 So if the intensity ratio is 25:9, the amplitude ratio will be 5:3.

questions.Question: The velocity of sound in air
questions.solution: Solution:		The velocity of sound in air decreases with decrease of temperature.

questions.Question: Infrasonic sound has a frequency lower than
questions.solution: Solution:		Infrasonic Sound has a frequency less than the audible frequency range. Frequencies are less than 20 Hz. The infrasonic sounds have below the lower limit of human hearing.

questions.Question: When a vibrating tuning fork is placed on a table, a loud sound is heard. This is due to :
questions.solution: Solution:		When a vibrating tuning fork is placed on a table, then a large sound is heard due to the entire system begins vibrating and forces surrounding air particles into vibration motion. The tendency of one object to force another adjoining or interconnected object into vibration motion is referred to as a forced vibration.

questions.Question: Quality of a musical note depends on
questions.optionD: Velocity of sound in the medium
questions.solution: Solution:		Quality of a musical note depends on harmonics present.

questions.Question: What is the direction of torque?
questions.optionA: Perpendicular to the direction of applied force
questions.optionB: Same as the direction of applied force
questions.optionC: Opposite to the direction of applied force
questions.solution: Solution:		The direction of torque is perpendicular to the direction of applied force.

questions.Question: The motion of a body around a circular path is an example of
questions.solution: Solution:		Uniform circular motion occurs when a body moves in a circular path with constant velocity. The acceleration of a body experiencing uniform circular motion is always directed toward the center of the circle (centripetal acceleration orac = V2 / r where v is the body’s velocity, and r is the radius of the circle). This acceleration is constant in magnitude but changes in direction, so, it is variable at every point of the circular path.

questions.Question: What should a person on a freely rotating turn table do to decrease his (angular) speed ?
questions.solution: Solution:		When a person on a turn table will raise his hands, there will be increase in the momentum of inertia. Hence, the angular velocity of the turntable will decrease.

questions.Question: A sphere rolls down on two inclined planes of different angles but same height, it does so
questions.optionC: In the same time with the same speed
questions.optionD: In the same time with the same kinetic energy
questions.solution: Solution:		A solid sphere rolls down two different inclined planes of the same height but of different inclinations. The speed and the of descend will be same.

questions.Question: If a body moves with a constant speed in a circle
questions.optionA: No work is done on it
questions.optionC: No acceleration is produced in it
questions.solution: Solution:		 If a body moves with a constant speed in a circle its velocity remains constant.

questions.Question: What is the reason for twinkling of stars ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Atmospheric refraction is the reason behind the twinkling of stars. The starlight on entering earth surface undergoes refraction continuously before it reaches to earth. The starlight bend towards the normal as it enters from rarer to denser medium. The air near the earth surface is denser than upper layers. Therefore the apparent position of the stars are slightly different from its actual position, when it is viewed from horizon. The apparent position of stars are not stationary and keeps on changing slightly, because the physical condition of the atmosphere are not stationary. Because of this the stars sometimes appears brighter and sometimes appear fainter.

questions.Question: The basic reason for the extraordinary sparkle of suitably cut diamond is that
questions.optionA: It has well defined cleavage planes
questions.optionB: It has a very high transparency
questions.optionC: It has a very high refractive index
questions.solution: Solution:		The basic reason for the extraordinary sparkle of suitably cut diamond is that it has a very high refractive index.

questions.Question: Refractive Index of glass with respect to water is
questions.solution: Solution:		Refractive Index of glass with respect to water is 9/8.

questions.Question: Which of the following colour of light deviates least through the prism?
questions.solution: Solution:		Red light suffers the least amount of deviation and violet the most. When a white light is made to pass through a prism, formation of a spectrum of seven colors occurs showing white light is a combination of seven separate colours.

questions.Question: Bending of light rays in denser medium is termed as:
questions.solution: Solution:		The bending of light as it passes from one medium to another is called refraction. The angle and wavelength at which the light enters a substance and the density of that substance determine how much the light is refracted.

questions.Question: Stars appears to move from east to west because
questions.optionA: All stars move from east to west
questions.optionB: The earth rotates from west to east
questions.optionC: The earth rotates from east to west
questions.optionD: The background of the stars moves from west to east
questions.solution: Solution:The earth rotates from west to east.

questions.Question: Pa(Pascal) is the unit for

questions.Question: Planets do not twinkle because

questions.optionB: Their distance from the earth does not  change with time
questions.optionC: They are very far away from the earth resulting in decrease in intensity of light
questions.optionD: They are nearer to earth and hence we receive a greater amount of light.
questions.solution: Solution:They are nearer to earth and hence we receive a greater amount of light.

questions.Question: Metals are good conductors of electricity because:
questions.solution: Solution:		Metals are good conductors of electricity because they contain free electrons.

questions.Question: Let a thin capillary tube be replaced with another tube of insufficient length then, we find water
questions.solution: Solution:		When length of capillary tube is insufficient then we would observe no rise on level of water because their will be no air pressure created enough to rise the water level.

questions.Question: The boiling point of water depends upon the
questions.solution: Solution:		The boiling point of water depends upon the atmospheric pressure.

questions.Question: One bar is equal to
questions.solution: Solution:		One bar is equal to 105 Pa.

questions.Question: Pressure Cooker cooks faster because
questions.optionA: Boiling point decreases with rise of pressure
questions.optionB: It cooks the food at low pressure
questions.optionC: Higher temperature is attained for cooking
questions.optionD: The material of the cooker is a good conductor
questions.solution: Solution:		Food is cooked more quickly in a pressure cooker because at the higher pressure (1 bar/15 psi), the boiling point of water rises from 100°C (212°F) to 121°C (250°F). Since less water or liquid has to be heated, the food reaches its cooking temperature faster.

questions.Question: In a particular system, the units of length, mass and time are chosen to be 10 cm, 10 g and 0.1 s respectively. The unit of force in this system will be equivalent to
questions.solution: Solution:		Mass = 10 g = 0.01 kgLength = 10 cm = 0.1 mTime = 0.1 sForce = mass × length/ time ^2= > Force = 0.01 × 0.1 × 0.1-2 = 0.1 N

questions.Question: The weakest of all fundamental forces is
questions.solution: Solution:		Gravitation is by far the weakest of the four interactions at the atomic scale, where electromagnetic interactions dominate.

questions.Question: Rate of change of displacement is known as ________
questions.solution: Solution:		The rate of change of displacement of an object (displacement over elapsed time) is velocity. Velocity is a vector since it has both magnitude (called speed) and direction.

questions.Question: When a ball is thrown vertically upwards, which of the following quantities remains constant during its motion?
questions.solution: Solution:		When the body is thrown vertically upwards, its acceleration will remain constant. While its speed will become zero at the peak of its projection and thus kinetic energy changes.

questions.Question: For a body moving with non-uniform velocity and uniform acceleration
questions.solution: Solution:		For a body moving with non-uniform velocity and uniform acceleration, Displacement – Time graph is non-linear.

questions.Question: A man standing on a edge of a cliff throws a stone vertically upwards with a certain speed. He then throws another stone downwards with the same speed. Find the ratio of the speeds of the two stones when they hit the ground.
questions.optionD: Cannot be found from the given information.
questions.solution: Solution:		When man throws the stone upward with speed u and downward with speed u, the initial velocity (from the cliff) will be the same. Hence, this will result in equal final velocity. Hence the ratio is 1:1.

questions.Question: Scalar Quantities are
questions.optionA: Physical quantities which have magnitude only and no direction
questions.optionB: Physical quantities which have no magnitude only and only direction
questions.optionC: Physical quantities which have magnitude only and direction
questions.optionD: Physical quantities which have no magnitude and no direction
questions.solution: Solution:		Scalar Quantities are physical quantities which have magnitude only and no direction.

questions.Question: Solar cells work on the principle of
questions.solution: Solution:		Photovoltaic modules, commonly called solar modules, are the key components used to convert sunlight into electricity. Light striking the crystals induces the “photovoltaic effect,” which generates electricity. The electricity produced is called direct current (DC) and can be used immediately or stored in a battery.

questions.Question: Wind and solar energy are examples of
questions.solution: Solution:		Wind and solar energy are examples of renewable sources of energy.

questions.Question: Electrostatic precipitator is used to control the pollution of
questions.solution: Solution:		Originally designed for recovery of valuable industrial-process materials, electrostatic precipitators are used for air pollution control, particularly for removing particles from waste gases at industrial facilities and power-generating stations.

questions.Question: Hydro-electric power is a:
questions.optionB: A mixture of renewable and non-renewable natural resource
questions.optionC: Neither renewable nor non renewable resource
questions.solution: Solution:		Hydro-electric power is a renewable natural resource.

questions.Question: Energy that is produced commercially from coal is called
questions.solution: Solution:		Energy that is produced commercially from coal is called thermal energy.

questions.Question: Energy per unit volume is dimensionally equal to
questions.solution: Solution:		Energy per unit volume is dimensionally equal to pressure.

questions.Question: To open a door easily, the handle should be fixed

questions.solution: Solution:		None of the above

questions.Question: Water boils at a lower temperature on the hills because
questions.optionA: It is cold on the hills
questions.optionB: There is less carbon dioxide on the hills
questions.optionC: There is a decrease in air pressure on the hills
questions.solution: Solution:		The boiling point of water is lower at higher altitudes due to the decreased atmospheric pressure. A liquid boils when its vapour pressure exceeds the local total pressure. As the atmospheric pressure drops, the Vapour pressure increases more than the local pressure at an even lower temperature.

questions.Question: The force exerted by a magnet is an example of ________
questions.solution: Solution:		The force exerted by a magnet is an example of Non-contact force.

questions.Question: A man standing close to the platform at a railway station experiences a pulling force towards a fast moving train because of ________ .
questions.optionA: Gravitational force between train and man
questions.optionD: Pressure difference due to fast moving air in between
questions.solution: Solution:		When a fast-moving train passes a man standing on the platform at rest, the air between train and person also moves with greater speed. This rapidly moving air, by Bernoulli's principle will have a lower pressure than the still air a few feet away.

questions.Question: Light Emitting Diodes (LED) is used in fancy electronic devices such as toys emit
questions.solution: Solution:		Light Emitting Diodes (LED) is used in fancy electronic devices such as toys emit visible light.

questions.Question: Out of the following pairs, which one does not have identical dimension?
questions.optionA: Moment of inertia and moment of a force
questions.solution: Solution:		Moment of inertia and moment of a force does not have identical dimension.

questions.Question: Mercury is commonly used as a thermometric fluid rather than water because
questions.optionA: specific heat of mercury is less than water
questions.optionB: specific heat of mercury is more than water
questions.optionC: mercury has greater visibility than water
questions.optionD: density of mercury is more than the water
questions.solution: Solution:Mercury has greater visibility than water.

questions.Question: Optical  fibre works on the
questions.solution: Solution:		The optical fibre is a device which works on the principle of total internal reflection by which light signals can be transmitted from one place to another with a negligible loss of energy. Characteristics of Optical Fibre: It has a large bandwidth.

questions.Question: Light from the star, Alpha Centauri, which is nearest to the earth after the sun, reaches the earth in
questions.solution: Solution:		Light from the nearest star reaches the earth in 4.2 years. The closest star to Earth are three stars in the Alpha Centauri system.

questions.Question: The coil wire in the electric room heater or electric cooking heater is called ________
questions.solution: Solution:		The coil wire in the electric room heater or electric cooking heater is called element.

questions.Question: The composition of electrician solder is
questions.solution: Solution:		The composition of electrician solder is Lead-37%, tin-63%.

questions.Question: An electric iron of 750 W is used for S hours per day. Then the energy consumed in one day by the iron is:
questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: The purpose of choke in tube light is
questions.solution: Solution:		 When the switch is ON, in a tube light choke is nothing but the coil/ballast (inductor) which is used to induce the high voltage across it.

questions.Question: Electricity is transmitted over long distances
questions.optionB: There is less wastage of energy
questions.solution: Solution:		The primary reason that power is transmitted at high voltages is to increase efficiency. As electricity is transmitted over long distances, there are inherent energy losses along the way.

questions.Question: Which of the following is not a part of a CRT ?
questions.solution: Solution:		The cathode ray tube (CRT) is a vacuum tube containing an electron gun (a source of electrons or electron emitter) and a fluorescent screen used to view images. Colour tubes use three different phosphors which emit red, green, and blue light respectively. They are packed together in stripes (as in aperture grille designs) or clusters called “triads” (as in shadow mask CRTs).

questions.Question: Slip rings are usually made of
questions.solution: Solution:		Slip rings are usually made of Phosphor Bronze.

questions.Question: The safest hammers are those with heads that are
questions.solution: Solution:		The safest hammers are those with heads that are alloy and drop-forged steel.

questions.Question: The function of ball bearings in a wheel is :
questions.optionB: To convert kinetic friction into rolling friction
questions.optionC: To convert static friction into kinetic friction
questions.solution: Solution:		A ball bearing is a type of rolling-element bearing that uses balls to maintain the separation between the bearing races. The purpose of a ball bearing is to reduce rotational friction and support radial and axial loads. In general, it’s main function is to convert kinetic friction into rolling friction. It achieves this by using at least two races to contain the balls and transmit the loads through the balls.

questions.Question: Gear finishing operation is called
questions.solution: Solution:		Gear finishing operation is called burnishing.

questions.Question: The hydraulic brakes used in automobiles is a direct application of :
questions.solution: Solution:		The hydraulic brakes used in automobiles is a direct application of Pascal's law.

questions.Question: If we want to calculate the pressure of a liquid at the bottom of a vessel, the quantity which is not required to determine it, is
questions.optionB: Surface area of the bottom of the vessel
questions.optionD: Acceleration due to gravity at the bottom of the vessel
questions.solution: Solution:		The pressure exerted by a static fluid depends only upon the depth of the fluid, the density of the fluid, and the acceleration of gravity. Static fluid pressure does not depend on the shape, total mass, or surface area of the liquid.

questions.Question: For which of the following game, players must have the knowledge of Pascal's law?
questions.solution: Solution:		Scuba diving players must have the knowledge of Pascal's law.

questions.Question: Air pressure is usually highest when the air is
questions.solution: Solution:		Air pressure is usually highest when the air is cool and moist.

questions.Question: Which process allows water to enter the atmosphere?
questions.solution: Solution:		Evaporation is the process that allows water to enter into the atmosphere. Sunlight turns liquid water into water vapor which then rises higher into the atmosphere and forms into clouds. Plants, too, help water get into the atmosphere through a process called transpiration.

questions.Question: Vehicle tyres are inflated properly
questions.optionB: To allow the vehicle to take more load.
questions.optionC: To avoid skidding and to minimise friction
questions.optionD: To go fast and save fuel.
questions.solution: Solution:		Vehicle tyres are inflated properly to avoid skidding and to minimise friction.

questions.Question: Friction is caused by the ________ on the two surfaces in contact.
questions.solution: Solution:		Friction is caused by the irregularities on the two surfaces in contact.

questions.Question: Ball bearings are used in cycles, scooters etc to
questions.optionA: Increase the friction between the wheel and the axle
questions.optionB: Reduce the friction between the wheel and the axle
questions.optionC: Reduce the friction between ground and the whee
questions.solution: Solution:		The purpose of a ball bearing is to reduce rotational friction and support radial and axial loads. Reduce the friction as rolling friction is the least, rather than sliding or static friction.

questions.Question: The force of friction between two surfaces will increase if:
questions.optionA: A layer of lubricant is kept between the two surfaces
questions.optionB: The two surfaces are pressed harder
questions.optionC: Air gap is created between the two surfaces
questions.optionD: Irregularities on both the surfaces are removed
questions.solution: Solution:		The friction between two surfaces can be increased if the surfaces are pressed into each other with greater force. The harder the brakes are pushed, the harder the pads get pressed into the discs and the more friction is generated.

questions.Question: Rolling friction is caused by ________
questions.solution: Solution:		Rolling friction is caused by non-elastic effects.

questions.Question: The bats can fly in the dark because
questions.optionA: They can see the objects in darkness
questions.optionB: They have weak legs and are likely to be attacked by predators
questions.solution: Solution:		Bats can fly in dark because they produce ultrasonic waves. ... It produces ultrasonic waves which strike with the obstacles present on its way.

questions.Question: The device used for locating submerged objects under sea is.
questions.solution: Solution:		Sonar (originally an acronym for Sound Navigation And Ranging) is a technique that uses sound propagation (usually underwater, as in submarine navigation) to navigate, communicate with or detect objects on or under the surface of the water, such as other vessels.

questions.Question: The sounds having a frequency of 20 Hertz to 20,000 Hertz are known as
questions.solution: Solution:		The sounds having a frequency of 20 Hertz to 20,000 Hertz are known as audible sounds.

questions.Question: In mirrors the back surface is coated with a thin layer of :
questions.solution: Solution:		In a spherical mirror, one of the two curved surfaces is coated with a thin layer of silver followed by a coating of red lead oxide paint. Thus, one side of the spherical mirror is opaque and the other side is a highly polished reflecting surface.

questions.Question: A light ray travelling from denser to rarer medium at an angle of incidence more than critical angle of concerned media pair suffers.
questions.solution: Solution:		If the angle of incidence of light ray in the denser medium is greater than the critical angle of the concerned media pair, the light is not at all reflected in to the rarer medium but is totally reflected. This is known as 'total internal reflection'.

questions.Question: Which of the following is not a form of Energy?
questions.solution: Solution:		Pressure is not a form of energy.

questions.Question: Which of the following is the second largest source of global energy?
questions.solution: Solution:		Data for 2013 shows that renewable electricity generation overtook natural gas to become the second largest source of electricity worldwide producing 22% of total electricity or 5,130 TWh. Some of the sources of renewable energy are: solar power, wind power, wave and tidal power, geothermal power, biomass and hydro power. Fossil fuels remained the bedrock of global electricity production with more than two-thirds (about 67%) of the total.

questions.Question: Which of the following is a renewable source of energy
questions.solution: Solution:		Some examples of renewable energy sources are solar energy, wind energy, hydro power, geothermal energy, and biomass energy.

questions.Question: The energy that generates wind comes from what source?
questions.solution: Solution:		The energy that generates wind comes from solar radiation.

questions.Question: Solar energy is due to
questions.solution: Solution:		Solar energy is any type of energy generated by the sun. Solar energy is created by nuclear fusion that takes place in the sun. Fusion occurs when protons of hydrogen atoms violently collide in the sun's core and fuse to create a helium atom.

questions.Question: Hertz is the SI unit of
questions.solution: Solution:		Hertz is the SI unit of frequency.

questions.Question: The velocity of the sound is highest in
questions.solution: Solution:		The velocity of the sound is highest in metal.

questions.Question: The ordinary and maximum tolerance limit of sound by human being is
questions.solution: Solution:		The ordinary and maximum tolerance limit of sound by human being is 60 db to 80 db (decibel).

questions.Question: In SONAR which kind of wave is used?
questions.solution: Solution:		In SONAR ultrasonic wave is used.

questions.Question: Sound waves cannot travel through
questions.solution: Solution:		Sound waves cannot travel through vacuum.

questions.Question: Force of impact is the force
questions.optionB: By the speed of the object
questions.solution: Solution:		Force of impact is the force when the object meets.

questions.Question: A rubber ball is dropped from a height of 2 metres. To what height will it rise if there is no loss of energy/velocity after rebounding ?
questions.solution: Solution:		The potential energy of a body when raised through height h is given by mgh. Each time, a normal rubber ball hits the floor, it loses one-fifth of its total energy and the rebound height is proportional to energy, so each bounce will rebound to four-fifth of the previous bounce. But, the question states that there is no loss of energy/velocity after rebounding. So the height of 2 metres will be maintained.

questions.Question: A piece of paper and a cricket ball are dropped from the same height. Under which of the following conditions do both reach the surface simultaneously ?
questions.optionA: They must have the same volume
questions.optionB: They must have the same density
questions.optionC: They must have the same mass
questions.optionD: They must be dropped in vacuum
questions.solution: Solution:		When a piece of paper and a cricket ball are dropped from the same height, they reach the surface at different time because the shape of the paper is more flat and it behaves like a parachute causing more air resistance acting on it with respect to the ball. But, in order to reach the surface at the same time by both the articles, they must be dropped in vacuum. It is because in vacuum there is no other force other than force of gravity occurring on them and this leads to a conclusion that both the article reaches at the same time.

questions.Question: Angle of friction and angle of repose are
questions.solution: Solution:		Angle of friction and angle of repose are equal to each other.

questions.Question: The term ''Higgs Boson' is associated with
questions.solution: Solution:		The term ''Higgs Boson' is associated with God particle.

questions.Question: Sound travels at the fastest speed in
questions.solution: Solution:		Sound travels fastest through solids. This is because molecules in a solid medium are much closer together than those in a liquid or gas, allowing sound waves to travel more quickly through it. In fact, sound waves travel over 17 times faster through steel than through air.

questions.Question: Oil raise up the wick in a lamp. The principle involves
questions.optionA: the diffusion of oil through the wick
questions.solution: Solution:		The raise of oil up the wick in a lamp is an example of capillary action where adhesive forces are greater than cohesive forces.

questions.Question: Superconductors are substances which
questions.optionB: offer high resistance to the flow of current
questions.optionC: offer no resistance to the flow of electricity
questions.solution: Solution:		By definition, superconductors are substances which display zero electrical resistance when a current is supplied, and are able to propagate such a current in a circuit indefinitely.

questions.Question: Light travels at the fastest speed in:
questions.solution: Solution:		Light travels at the fastest speed in Vacuum.

questions.Question: Railway tracks are banked on curves
questions.optionA: necessary centrifugal force may be obtained from the horizontal component weight of the train
questions.optionB: to avoid frictional force between the tracks and wheels
questions.optionC: necessary centripetal force may be obtained from the horizontal component of the weight of the train
questions.optionD: the train may not fly off in the opposite direction
questions.solution: Solution:		When a fast moving train takes a curved path, it tends to move away tangentially off the track. In order to prevent this, the curved tracks are banked on the outside to produce the necessary centripetal force required to keep the train moving in a curved path.

questions.Question: A thin oil film on a water surface appears coloured because of
questions.solution: Solution:		A thin oil film on a water surface appears coloured because of thin-film interference which involves the interference of light waves reflecting off the top surface of a film with the waves reflecting from the bottom surface. The refractive index of oil is larger than that of water, therefore the reflection on the back side occurs.

questions.Question: The blue colour of sky is due to
questions.optionC: Scattering of shorter wavelengths of sunlight in the atmosphere
questions.optionD: Scattering of longer wavelengths of sunlight in the atmosphere
questions.solution: Solution:		Blue light is scattered in all directions by the tiny molecules of air in Earth's atmosphere. Blue is scattered more than other colors because it travels as shorter, smaller waves. This is why we see a blue sky most of the time. Closer to the horizon, the sky fades to a lighter blue or white.

questions.Question: The phenomenon of light associated with the appearance of blue colour of the sky is
questions.solution: Solution:		The phenomenon of light associated with the appearance of blue colour of the sky is scattering.

questions.Question: The sky appears blue because of
questions.optionD: Emision of blue wavelength by the sun
questions.solution: Solution:		Gases and particles in Earth's atmosphere scatter sunlight in all directions. Blue light is scattered more than other colors because it travels as shorter, smaller waves. This is why we see a blue sky most of the time.

questions.Question: Light scattering takes place in
questions.solution: Solution:		Light scattering takes place in colloidal solution. Colloid refers to substance which is extremely small and is known for equal dispersion through another material. In colloidal solution any matter is evenly suspended in the liquid.

questions.Question: The source of the Sun's energy is the process of
questions.solution: Solution:		Solar energy is any type of energy generated by the sun. Solar energy is created by nuclear fusion that takes place in the sun. Fusion occurs when protons of hydrogen atoms violently collide in the sun's core and fuse to create a helium atom.

questions.Question: Hot springs are heated geothermally by underlying
questions.solution: Solution:		Magma is molten rocks beneath the earth's crust. Hot springs are heated geothermally by underlying magma.

questions.Question: Which of the following is the cleanest source of energy?
questions.solution: Solution:		Wind energy is the cleanest source of energy.

questions.Question: The Solar energy produced by
questions.solution: Solution:		Solar energy is any type of energy generated by the sun. Solar energy is created by nuclear fusion that takes place in the sun. Fusion occurs when protons of hydrogen atoms violently collide in the sun's core and fuse to create a helium atom.

questions.Question: The oldest type of energy known to man is
questions.solution: Solution:		Geothermal energy is heat energy generated and stored in the Earth. Geothermal energy has been used for thousands of years in some countries for cooking and heating.

questions.Question: The best conductor of electricity among the following is :
questions.solution: Solution:		Silver is the best conductor of electricity.

questions.Question: Kilowatt-hour is the unit of :
questions.solution: Solution:		Kilowatt-hour is the unit of energy.

questions.Question: Copper wires are generally used for electrical power transmission instead of iron wire because :
questions.optionC: Copper is a better conductor of electricity than iron
questions.optionD: Copper can take higher power than iron
questions.solution: Solution:		Copper is generally preferred for electrical power transmission instead of iron because of its high electrical conductivity and low resistivity.

questions.Question: The earth-wire of a cable is connected to
questions.optionA: The outer metallic body of the appliance
questions.solution: Solution:		The earth-wire of a cable is connected to the fuse of the appliance.

questions.Question: Lightning is caused due to
questions.solution: Solution:		Lightning is an electrical discharge caused by imbalances between storm clouds and the ground, or within the clouds themselves. Most lightning occurs within the clouds.

questions.Question: In uniform circular motion, the linear velocity is perpendicular to
questions.solution: Solution:		In uniform circular motion, the linear velocity is perpendicular to radius vector.

questions.Question: Flywheel is an important part of a steam engine because it :
questions.optionA: Accelerates the speed of the engine
questions.optionB: Helps the engine in keeping the speed uniform
questions.solution: Solution:		A flywheel is a rotating mechanical device that is used to store rotational energy. Flywheels have a significant moment of inertia and thus resist changes in rotational speed, enabling the engine to run at a constant, uniform motion. In the Industrial Revolution, James Watt contributed to the development of the flywheel in the steam engine.

questions.Question: The following particles move with same kinetic energy. Which of them has maximum momentum ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Since alpha particle has higher mass than electron, proton and deuteron, its momentum will be maximum.

questions.Question: Should cars have bumpers that collapse under impact?
questions.optionA: Yes, since the offending car should get damaged and pay for the mistake
questions.optionB: No, since it would be very expensive to get the car repaired
questions.optionC: No, since the colliding car would then ram into the occupants and kill them
questions.optionD: Yes, since they help to absorb the impact of a collision and keep the occupants safe
questions.solution: Solution:		In automobiles, a bumper is the front-most or rearmost part, ostensibly designed to allow the car to sustain an impact without damage to the vehicle’s safety systems. They are not capable of reducing injury to vehicle occupants in high-speed impacts, but are increasingly being designed to mitigate injury to pedestrians struck by cars.

questions.Question: When the speed of car is doubled, then what will be the braking force of the car to stop it in the same distance ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Brake force, also known as Brake Power, is a measure of braking power of a vehicle. Suppose a car whose mass is ‘x’ and is braked from a speed of y km/hr to come to halt at a uniform retardation in z min. If the speed of the car is doubled in the same distance, then the braking force required to stop the car is four times the original speed i.e. ‘4v’. Note that all the parameters remain to be same.

questions.Question: The wall of a dam is broader at the base
questions.optionB: To withstand pressure that increases with depth
questions.optionC: To withstand pressure that increases in a horizontal plane
questions.optionD: To withstand pressure that is increased with atmospheric pressure
questions.solution: Solution:		The pressure applied to walls of the dam will be a function of the amount of water that is over that particular point on the wall. So water pressure is very large at the bottom due to its large depth. That's why dams are constructed thicker at their bottoms than at their tops.

questions.Question: It is easy to burst a gas-filled balloon with a needle than with a nail. It is because
questions.optionA: Nail is more longer than needle.
questions.optionB: Nail exerts more pressure than needle on the balloon.
questions.optionC: Needle exerts more pressure than nail on the balloon.

questions.Question: The spokes used in the wheel of a bicycle increase its
questions.solution: Solution:		A spoke is one of some number of rods radiating from the center of a wheel (the hub where the axle connects), connecting the hub with the round traction surface. Metal spokes used in bicycles also increase the moment of inertia.

questions.Question: It is difficult to cook rice
questions.optionA: At the top of a mountain
questions.solution: Solution:		At high altitude pressure is low and therefore the boiling point is also low. In this case, water starts boiling below its boiling point but rice cooks at 100. So, it is difficult to cook rice at high altitudes.

questions.Question: Sound of frequency below 20 Hz is called
questions.solution: Solution:		Sound of frequency below 20 Hz is called Infrasonic.

questions.optionB: enable it to withstand higher voltages

questions.Question: It takes much longer to cook food in the hills than in the plains, because
questions.optionA: in the hills the atmospheric pressure is lower than that in the plains and therefore water boils at a temperature lower than 100oC causing an increase in cooking time

questions.solution: Solution:		It takes much longer to cook food in the hills than in the plains, because in the hills the atmospheric pressure is lower than that in the plains and therefore water boils at a temperature lower than 100oC causing an increase in cooking time.

questions.Question: Which one of the following instruments is used to study dispersion of light ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Dispersion occurs when different frequencies of light have different phase velocities, due either to material properties (material dispersion) or to the geometry of an optical waveguide (waveguide dispersion). A spectrometer (spectro-photometer, spectrograph or spectroscope) is an instrument used to measure properties of light over a specific portion of the electromagnetic spectrum, typically used in spectroscopic analysis to identify materials. The variable measured is most often the light’s intensity but could also, for instance, be the polarization state.

questions.Question: Which one of the following is responsible for the working of Newton's colour disc experiment ?
questions.solution: Solution:		A Newton Disc can be created by painting a disc with the seven different colours. A combination of red, green and blue in the circular disc will yield the same result. This is due to the phenomenon called persistence of vision.

questions.Question: An object which absorbs all colours and reflects none appears:
questions.solution: Solution:		A black object absorbs all wavelengths of light and reflects none and that's why it appears black. Consequently, black absorbs the most heat.

questions.Question: Microphone is a device which transforms the
questions.solution: Solution:		Microphone is a device which transforms the sound signal into current signal.

questions.Question: Conversion of heat into electrical energy is achieved by using :
questions.solution: Solution:		Conversion of heat into electrical energy is achieved by using thermocouple.

questions.Question: A body of mass 2 kg is thrown upward with initial velocity of 20 m/s. After 2 seconds, its kinetic energy will be : (g = 10 m/s2)
questions.solution: Solution:		We will use the following equation of motion to get the final velocity after 2 seconds. V = u - gt U = 20 m/s g = 10 t = 2 V = 20 - 2 × 10 V = 20 - 20 V = 0 K.E = 1/2mv² m = 2 v = 0 K.E = 0.5 × 0 × 2= 0

questions.Question: The energy stored in a watch spring is
questions.solution: Solution:		When a spring is compressed, it stores energy in form of elastic potential energy.

questions.Question: An object that has kinetic energy must be
questions.solution: Solution:		In physics, we know that the kinetic energy of an object is the energy that it possesses due to its motion. It is defined as the work needed to accelerate a body of a given mass from rest to its stated velocity. Hence, An object that has kinetic energy must be in motion i.e, moving.

questions.Question: A mass of 20 kg is at a height of 8 m above the ground. Then the potential energy possessed by the body is: [Given g = 9.8 m/s2]
questions.solution: Solution:		A mass of 20 kg is at a height of 8 m above the ground. Then the potential energy possessed by the body is 1586 J.

questions.Question: A person lifts luggage of 20 kg from the ground and puts it on his head 2m above the ground. Calculate the work done by him. (g = 10 )
questions.solution: Solution:		Total work done in lifting and moving the luggage is 588 Joules. Explanation : 1. work done in lifting the luggage = potential energy of the luggage = mgh where, m = mass = 20 kg g = acceleration due to gravity = 9.8 m/s² h = height = 3 m Hence, P = mgh = 20 x 9.8 x 3 = 588 J 2. work done in moving the object, Since now weight of the luggage is acting in downward direction and the movement is in horizontal direction, hence work done in moving the luggage is zero because component of force along horizontal direction is zero. Total work done = 588 + 0 = 588 J. Hence total work done in lifting and moving the luggage588 J.

questions.Question: In a photocell light energy is converted into
questions.solution: Solution:		A photocell converts light energy into electrical energy.

questions.Question: A voltaic cell converts chemical energy to
questions.solution: Solution:		A galvanic (voltaic) cell converts the energy released by a spontaneous chemical reaction to electrical energy.

questions.Question: The work done by the string of a simple pendulum during one complete oscillation is equal to
questions.solution: Solution:		Work done by the string of the simple pendulum during one complete oscillation is zero. Pressure in the string precisely drops the segment parallel to the string.

questions.Question: Conversion of sound energy into electrical energy is done by
questions.solution: Solution:		Conversion of sound energy into electrical energy is done by microphone.
