questions.solution: Solution:		distance of trolley S = 10mforce F =50Nwork done = F. S=50×10=500J

questions.Question: Which of the following is not a property of heavy water ?
questions.optionA: Boiling point of heavy water is lower than that or ordinary water
questions.optionB: Density of heavy water is higher than that of ordinary water
questions.optionC: Freezing point of heavy water is higher than that of ordinary water
questions.solution: Solution:		Boiling point of heavy water is lower than that or ordinary water is not a property of heavy water.

questions.Question: Which of the following liquids is most viscous?
questions.solution: Solution:		Here oil is the most viscous liquid.

questions.Question: Small bubbles are perfectly spherical because of
questions.solution: Solution:		Surface tension is responsible for the shape of liquid droplets. Although easily deformed, droplets of water tend to be pulled into a spherical shape by the cohesive forces of the surface layer. In the absence of other forces, including gravity, drops of virtually all liquids would be perfectly spherical. The spherical shape minimizes the necessary “wall tension” of the surface layer according to Laplace’s law.

questions.Question: Pitot tube is used to measure
questions.solution: Solution:		Pitot tube is used to measure stagnation pressure.

questions.Question: A spherical ball made of steel when dropped in mercury container
questions.optionB: Will be on the surface of mercury
questions.solution: Solution:		The density of steel usually ranges between 7.75 and 8.05 g/cm3 and the density of mercury is 13.534 g/cm3. Mercury is denser than steel this will mean that the buoyant force is large enough to float the steel ball. Different materials usually have different densities, so density is an important concept regarding buoyancy, purity and packaging. Osmium and iridium are the densest known elements at standard conditions for temperature and pressure but not the densest materials. Less dense fluids float on more dense fluids if they do not mix.

questions.Question: The velocity of sound in moist air is more than in dry air because the moist air has
questions.solution: Solution:		The density of dry air is more than that of moist air (when moisture is removed from air, its density increases). The speed of sound in a medium is inversely proportional to the square root of its density. Therefore, the speed of sound in moist air is more than that in dry air.

questions.Question: Which one among the following doesn't have any effect on velocity of sound ?
questions.solution: Solution:		The speed of sound varies depending on the temperature, pressure, and density of the medium through which the sound waves travel. In most of the cases, it is density which matters. Sound travels faster through denser air (or other material). The density of air is affected by atmospheric pressure, temperature, and altitude.

questions.Question: Velocity of sound in air does not change with the change of
questions.optionD: Wind in the direction of propagation of sound
questions.solution: Solution:		Air pressure has no effect at all in an ideal gas approximation. This is because pressure and density both contribute to sound velocity equally, and in an ideal gas the two effects cancel out, leaving only the effect of temperature. Sound usually travels more slowly with greater altitude, due to reduced temperature.

questions.Question: The propagation of sound waves in a gas involves
questions.solution: Solution:		An adiabatic process is one that occurs without transfer of heat or matter between a thermodynamic system and its surroundings. In an adiabatic process, energy is transferred only as work. Rarefaction is the reduction of an item’s density, the opposite of compression.

questions.Question: When two similar sources vibrate with slightly different frequencies, a regular rise and fall occurs in the loudness of tone. This phenomenon is known as
questions.solution: Solution:		When two similar sources vibrate with slightly different frequencies, a regular rise and fall occurs in the loudness of tone. This phenomenon is known as beats.

questions.Question: The electrical domestic tube light gives white fluorescent light because of
questions.optionA: Colision between molecules of filled gas under electric current
questions.optionD: Falling of ultra violet rays on the white inner coating of the tube
questions.solution: Solution:		The electrical domestic tube light gives white fluorescent light because of falling of ultra violet rays on the white inner coating of the tube. The ultraviolet rays have high frequency and shorter wavelength are converted to visible white light with lower frequency and greater wave length.

questions.Question: The unit for measuring electric power is the
questions.solution: Solution:		Electricity is measured in units of power called Watts, named to honour James Watt, the inventor of the steam engine.

questions.Question: The device used to change the speed of an electric fan is
questions.solution: Solution:		The device used to change the speed of an electric fan is regulator.

questions.Question: The material used in electric heater is
questions.solution: Solution:		Most heating elements use Nichrome 80/20 (80% nickel, 20% chromium) wire, ribbon, or strip. Nichrome 80/20 is an ideal material, because it has relatively high resistance and forms an adherent layer of chromium oxide when it is heated for the first time. Material beneath this layer will not oxidize, preventing the wire from breaking or burning out. Hence, Nichrome is used as heating elements.

questions.Question: After long periods of use, a grey spot develops on the inside of a bulb. This is because
questions.optionA: The tungsten filament evaporates and collects there
questions.optionB: The heat of the bulb scorches the glass at the top
questions.optionC: Dust inside the bulb condenses on the top
questions.optionD: Glass undergoes a change due to the heat
questions.solution: Solution:		At high operating temperatures, tungsten evaporates from the filament and gradually forms a gray film on the inside of the bulb. The inert gas atoms collide with the evaporating tungsten, causing some of the tungsten atoms to return to the filament.

questions.Question: The splitting of white light into its components is due to:
questions.solution: Solution:		Dispersion of light is the splitting of white light into its constituent colors due to the refractive index of the surface and the wavelength of the light.

questions.Question: Which of the following is used to split white light into different colours ?
questions.solution: Solution:		In optics, a prism is a transparent optical element with flat, polished surfaces that refract light. At least two of the flat surfaces must have an angle between them. The exact angles between the surfaces depend on the application. The traditional geometrical shape is that of a triangular prism with a triangular base and rectangular sides, and in colloquial use “prism” usually refers to this type. A prism can be used to break light up into its constituent spectral colours (the colours of the rainbow). Prisms can also be used to reflect light, or to split light into components with different polarizations. Prisms are sometimes used for the internal reflection at the surfaces rather than for dispersion.

questions.Question: What colour does blue and yellow make?
questions.solution: Solution:		Blue + Yellow pigment yields the colour green.

questions.Question: Which colour has the highest frequency?
questions.solution: Solution:		Violet waves have the highest frequencies.

questions.Question: The splitting of different colours of light in a prism is :
questions.solution: Solution:		The splitting of different colours of light in a prism is disperson of light.

questions.Question: Speed of sound in air is unaffected by change in
questions.solution: Solution:		Humidity has little effect on the speed of sound, nor does air pressure by itself. Air pressure has no effect at all in an ideal gas approximation. This is because pressure and density both contribute to sound velocity equally, and in an ideal gas the two effects cancel out, leaving only the effect of temperature.

questions.Question: RADAR is used for
questions.optionA: Detecting and locating the position of objects such as Aeroplanes
questions.optionD: Receiving a signals in a radio receiver
questions.solution: Solution:		Radar, electromagnetic sensor used for detecting, locating, tracking, and recognizing objects of various kinds at considerable distances. It operates by transmitting electromagnetic energy toward objects, commonly referred to as targets, and observing the echoes returned from them.

questions.Question: What is the minimum distance (in metres) required to hear an echo?
questions.solution: Solution:		The velocity of sound in dry air is approximately 343 m/s at a temperature of 25 °C. Therefore, the reflecting object must be more than 17.2 m from the sound source for echo to be perceived by a person located at the source.

questions.Question: Sound travels fastest in
questions.solution: Solution:		Sound travels fastest in glass.

questions.Question: Which among the following determines the pitch of a sound?
questions.solution: Solution:		Frequency is the number of occurrences of a repeating event per unit of time. It is also referred to as temporal frequency, which emphasizes the contrast to spatial frequency and angular frequency.

questions.Question: Which is best used as a sound absorbing material in partition walls ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Glass wool is best used as a sound absorbing material in partition walls. This is so because glass wool do not transfer mechanical energy. These tend to be soft, flexible, low density, and with high surface area to linear area ratios.

questions.Question: Speed of sound is the greatest in :
questions.solution: Solution:		Speed of sound is the greatest in glass.

questions.Question: The pitch of sound depends on its
questions.solution: Solution:		Pitch depends on frequency but also on loudness and spectrum.

questions.Question: What apparatus is used to locate a submerged object?
questions.solution: Solution:		Sonar (originally an acronym for Sound Navigation And Ranging) is a technique that uses sound propagation (usually underwater, as in submarine navigation) to navigate, communicate with or detect objects on or under the surface of the water, such as other vessels.

questions.Question: A decibel is
questions.solution: Solution:		Decibel (dB), unit for expressing the ratio between two physical quantities, usually amounts of acoustic or electric power, or for measuring the relative loudness of sounds. One decibel (0.1 bel) equals 10 times the common logarithm of the power ratio.

questions.Question: Necessary element of change in solar energy to electrical energy
questions.solution: Solution:		Necessary element of change in solar energy to electrical energy Silicon.

questions.Question: In hydro power station, the motion produced in turbines is due to
questions.solution: Solution:		In hydel power station, the motion produced in turbines is due to flow of water.

questions.Question: The SI unit for measuring work and energy is
questions.solution: Solution:		The SI unit for measuring work and energy is Joule.

questions.Question: In a rechargeable cell what kind of energy is stored within the cell?
questions.solution: Solution:		Electric energy is converted into chemical energy and stored it as chemical energy within the cells.

questions.Question: A bullet is fired from a rifle which recoils after firing. The ratio of kinetic energy of the rifle to that of the bullet is
questions.solution: Solution:		Since, the the mass of the bullet is smaller than the mass of the rifle hence, the velocity of the bullet is more than the rifle recoil velocity. Also, kinetic energy is inversely proportional to the mass. Hence, when a bullet is fired from a rifle and the rifle recoils freely then the kinetic energy of the rifle will be less than that of bullet.

questions.optionB: Accidents due to contraction in winter can be avoided

questions.optionC: Air vapourises the sweat on our body.

Our body tries to cool ourselves by releasing sweat through pores of our skin. And when we sit under the fan, the sweat of our body evaporates due to directed air upon us making our body cool.

questions.Question: When hot-water is sprinkled on a hotter glass tumbler, it breaks because
questions.solution: Solution:		If the poured liquid is relatively hotter or colder in comparison to the tumbler, it will break. When hot water is poured into a tumbler there is an uneven increase in the thermal expansion of the walls of the vessel.

questions.Question: When a pail of water is swung in a vertical circle, the water does not fall out at the top of the loop when the speed is

questions.optionB: Above a certain minimum value irrespective of amount of water in the pail
questions.optionC: Above a certain minimum value depending on amount of water in the pail
questions.optionD: Below a certain minimum value depending on amount of water in the pail

At every point in the circle the water tries to fall vertically out due to the force of gravity g but also tries to move in a straight line due to its circular motion.

questions.Question: Fat can be seperated from milk in a cream seperator because of :
questions.solution: Solution:		A separator is a high-speed centrifuge that acts on the principle that cream or butterfat is lighter than other components in milk. Fat can be separated from milk in a cream separator because of Centrifugal forces.

questions.Question: In case of uniform circular motion, the acceleration is
questions.optionA: Variable in magnitude but constant in direction
questions.optionB: Constant in magnitude and directed radially inwards
questions.optionC: Variable in magnitude but tangential to the circle
questions.solution: Solution:		In case of uniform circular motion, the acceleration is variable in magnitude but constant in direction.

questions.Question: Why is it difficult to breathe at higher altitudes?
questions.solution: Solution:		At high altitudes, oxygen molecules are further apart because there is less pressure to "push" them together. This effectively means there are fewer oxygen molecules in the same volume of air as we inhale.

questions.Question: The Hydraulic Break works on the principle of ________ .
questions.solution: Solution:		Hydraulic brakes work on the principle of Pascal's law.

questions.Question: Hydraulic brakes work on the principle of
questions.solution: Solution:		Hydraulic brakes work on the principle of Pascal's law.

questions.Question: What principle/law explains the working of the hydraulic brakes in automobiles ?
questions.solution: Solution:		The hydraulic brakes in automobiles works on the principle of Pascal's law.

questions.Question: Air moves from the region where the air ________
questions.optionA: Humidity is high to the region where the humidity is low
questions.optionB: Pressure is low to the region where the pressure is high
questions.optionC: Pressure is high to the region where the pressure is low
questions.optionD: Humidity is low to the region where the humidity is high
questions.solution: Solution:		Air moves from the region where the air pressure is high to the region where the pressure is low.

questions.Question: When a bullet is fired from a gun
questions.optionD: The gun recoils with the same momentum as the bullet
questions.solution: Solution:		When a bullet is fired from a gun, the gun exerts a force on the bullet in the forward direction. This is force is called as the action force. The bullet also exerts an equal and opposite force on the gun in the backward direction. Therefore a gun recoils when a bullet is fired from it.

questions.Question: The inability of a body to change its state of rest or uniform motion along a straight line is called its
questions.solution: Solution:		The inability of a body to change its state of rest or its uniform motion in a straight line is called as Inertia.

questions.Question: The moment of inertia of a body does not depend upon its
questions.solution: Solution:		Moment of inertia depends on distribution of body, axis of rotation and mass of the body. It is not dependent on angular velocity of the body.

questions.Question: An athlete runs before long jump to get advantage on
questions.solution: Solution:		An athlete runs before long jump to get advantage on inertia of motion.

questions.Question: What is the gravity of moon as compared to the Earth
questions.solution: Solution:		The Moon's surface gravity is about 1/6th as powerful or about 1.6 meters per second. The Moon's surface gravity is weaker because it is far less massive than Earth. A body's surface gravity is proportional to its mass, but inversely proportional to the square of its radius.

questions.Question: When a card placed over a tumbler is flicked with the finger, the coin placed over it falls in the tumbler.
questions.solution: Solution:		 A flick is given to the card with finger, the card flies away and the coin falls in the tumbler. It is explained by saying that due to inertia, the coin remained at its own place and the card went away due to the flick.

questions.Question: According to the Second Law of Motion, for a given force, acceleration is inversely proportional to the ________ of an object.
questions.solution: Solution:		According to the second law of motion for a given force, the acceleration of the object is inversely proportional to the mass of the object. Therefore, more the mass less is the acceleration and vice versa.

questions.Question: Why does a cannon recoil after firing ?
questions.solution: Solution:		In technical terms, the recoil is a result of conservation of momentum, as according to Newton's third law the force required to accelerate something will evoke an equal but opposite reactional force, which means the forward momentum gained by the projectile and exhaust gases will be mathematically balanced.
