questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: Propagation of sound can be visualised as propagation of ________ variations in the medium
questions.solution: Solution:		Pressure is related to the number of particles of the medium in a given volume. More density of the particles in the medium gives more pressure and vice-versa. Thus, propagation of sound may be visualised as propagation of pressure variations or density variations in the medium.

questions.Question: Permissible noise level at Residential area during night time is :
questions.solution: Solution:		In commercial areas, it is 65 dB and 55 dB while in residential areas it is 55 dB and 45 dB during daytime and night respectively.

questions.Question: Calculate the time period (in seconds) of a sound wave of wavelength 4m traveling with a speed of 500m/s
questions.solution: Solution:		Frequency = velocity/wavelength= 500/4= 125Time period = 1/Frequency= 1/125= 0.008

questions.Question: Which waves cannot be transmitted through vacuum?
questions.solution: Solution:		Sound waves cannot travel in the vacuum of space because there is no medium to transmit these mechanical waves. Classical waves transfer energy without transporting matter through the medium.

questions.Question: Submerged objects can be located using
questions.solution: Solution:		Sonar (originally an acronym for Sound Navigation And Ranging) is a technique that uses sound propagation (usually underwater, as in submarine navigation) to navigate, communicate with or detect objects on or under the surface of the water, such as other vessels.

questions.Question: The absolute refractive index of any medium is always:
questions.solution: Solution:		Absolute refractive index refers to a condition when light travels from vacuum to any other medium. As the absolute refractive index of a particular medium is supposed to be the refractive index of that medium in respect to the vacuum it will be the same for light as well. It will be greater than 1.

questions.Question: Lens is made up of
questions.solution: Solution:		A lens is a transmissive optical device that focuses or disperses a light beam by the process of refraction. Flint glass is used as an optical glass because it has relatively high refractive index and low Abbe number than other materials.

questions.Question: 'Mirage' is an example of
questions.optionB: Total internal reflection of light only
questions.optionC: Refraction and total internal reflection of light
questions.solution: Solution:		'Mirage' is an example of refraction and total internal reflection of light.

questions.Question: Mirage is due to
questions.optionB: Equal heating of different parts of the atmosphere
questions.optionC: Unequal heating of different parts of the atmosphere
questions.optionD: Depletion of ozone layer in the atmosphere
questions.solution: Solution:		Mirage is due to unequal heating of different parts of the atmosphere.

questions.Question: A water tank appears shallower when it is viewed from top due to
questions.solution: Solution:		The bending of light (i.e. refraction of light) as it moves from water to air makes the water tank appear to be less shallower than its real depth.

questions.Question: What is the force of attraction between any two bodies by virtue of their masses is called?
questions.solution: Solution:		The attractive force that the celestial bodies exert on other masses by virtue of their total mass is called the force of gravity or gravitational force.

questions.Question: If a boy sitting in a train, which is moving at a constant velocity, throws a ball straight up into the air, the ball will
questions.solution: Solution:		The ball is thrown in vertically upward direction and given that the train is moving up with a constant velocity. Therefore, the horizontal velocity of the train and ball are both same. And, the ball travels the same horizontal distance as that of the train. Therefore, the ball will come back into the hands of thrower.

questions.Question: When a bar magnet is cut into two equal halves, the pole strength of each piece –
questions.solution: Solution:		The pole strength of each piece when a bar magnet is cut into two equal halves perpendicular to its length is the same as the pole strength of the original bar magnet. However, the magnetic moment of each piece is half the magnetic moment of the original bar magnet.

questions.Question: A permanent magnet can affect
questions.solution: Solution:		A permanent magnet can affect both magnets and electromagnets.

questions.Question: A freely suspended magnet remains horizontal at
questions.solution: Solution:		A freely suspended magnet remains horizontal at the magnet equator.

questions.Question: Ohm's law is valid in case of
questions.solution: Solution:		Ohm's law is valid in case of conductor.

questions.Question: Electrical burns occur principally because of
questions.optionB: The heat generated by the flow of electrical current through the body
questions.solution: Solution:		Electrical burns are among the most serious burns and require immediate medical attention. They occur when electric current flows through tissues or bone, generating heat that causes tissue damage. Arc or flash burns result from high temperatures caused by an electric arc or explosion near the body.

questions.Question: The SI unit of resistance is:
questions.solution: Solution:		The SI unit of resistance is Ohm.

questions.Question: Electrical Energy is the energy of
questions.solution: Solution:		The SI unit of resistance is electrons.

questions.Question: As water is cooled from 4 deg C to 0 deg C, its density
questions.solution: Solution:		When water is cooled from 4°C to 0°C, its density decreases.

questions.Question: When heated from 0 to 100oC volume of a given mass of water will :
questions.solution: Solution:		From water at 0°C to water at 4°C, on addition of heat, the watersurprisingly, contracts till it reaches maximum density at 4°C. This negative thermal expansion is termed as the anomalous expansion of water. From water at 4°C to water at 100°C, water shows a positive cubical thermal expansion like other substances and gradually expand with the increase in temperature.

questions.Question: When a bottle of perfume is opened in one corner of a room the smell spreads soon throughout the room. This is an example of
questions.solution: Solution:		When a bottle of perfume is opened in a corner of a room, the scent soon spreads all over the room. This physical procedure is called diffusion, due to which the liquid or gaseous molecules travels from the area of higher density to that of the lower density of that substance.

questions.Question: Which of the following laws validates the statement that matter can neither be created nor destroyed ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Law of conservation of mass validates the statement that matter can neither be created nor destroyed.

questions.Question: The boiling point of liquids vary as
questions.solution: Solution:		The boiling point of a liquid varies according to the applied pressure; the normal boiling point is the temperature at which the vapour pressure is equal to the standard sea-level atmospheric pressure (760 mm [29.92 inches] of mercury). At sea level, water boils at 100°C (212°F).

questions.Question: The freezing point of fresh water is ________ .
questions.solution: Solution:		Freezing point is the temperature where a liquid converts into solid. Water converts into ice at zero degrees centigrade. So degree zero centigrade is the freezing point of water.

questions.Question: It is easier to roll a barrel full of coal tar than to pull it because
questions.optionA: the full weight of the barrel comes into play when it is pulled
questions.optionB: the rolling friction is much less than the sliding friction
questions.optionC: more surface area of the barrel is in contact with the road when it is pulled
questions.optionD: coal tar is a liquid and it flows in the barrel when it is rolled
questions.solution: Solution:		When a body slides (moves with all its surface area in contact) over another body, the resistance faced is due to sliding friction. Hence rolling friction is less than the sliding friction. Thus it is easier to roll a barrel full of coal tar than to pull it.

questions.Question: Minimum number of unequal vectors which can give zero resultant are
questions.solution: Solution:		The minimum number of vectors of unequal magnitude required to produce zero resultant is three.

questions.Question: Intensity of sound has
questions.solution: Solution:		Intensity of sound has an object existence.

questions.Question: Rain is falling vertically downwards. To a man running east-wards, the rain will appear to be coming from
questions.solution: Solution:		With vertical, the relative velocity will be inclined and appear to be coming from east.So the rain will appear to be coming from east.

questions.Question: An aeroplane is flying horizontally with a velocity of 600 km/h and at a height of 1960 m. When it is vertically at a point A on the ground a bomb is released from it. The bomb strikes the ground at point B. The distance AB is
questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: The wavelength at which the peak of intensity of blackbody radiation occurs
questions.optionC: Is the same at all temperatures
questions.optionD: Does not follow any pattern as temperature changes
questions.solution: Solution:		According to Wien’s displacement law, when the temperature of a blackbody radiator increases, the overall radiated energy increases. Wavelength of maximum emission from a blackbody is inversely proportional to its temperature. Shorter-wavelength (higher-frequency) light corresponds to higher-energy photons.

questions.Question: Which of the following principle is used to produce ''low-temperatures' ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Magnetic refrigeration is a cooling technology based on the magneto-caloric effect. This technique can be used to attain extremely low temperatures, as well as the ranges used in common refrigerators, depending on the design of the system. The magnetocaloric effect (MCE, from magnet and calorie) is a magneto-thermodynamic phenomenon in which a change in temperature of a suitable material is caused by exposing the material to a changing magnetic field. This is also known by low temperature physicists as adiabatic demagnetization, due to the application of the process specifically to create a temperature drop

questions.Question: The first law of thermodynamics is simply the case of
questions.optionD: The law of conservation of energy
questions.solution: Solution:		The First Law of Thermodynamics states that heat is a form of energy, and thermodynamic processes are therefore subject to the principle of conservation of energy. This means that heat energy cannot be created or destroyed.

questions.Question: The commonly used coolant in refrigerators is
questions.solution: Solution:		Modern refrigerators usually use a refrigerant called HFC-134a (1,1,1,2-Tetrafluoroethane), which does not deplete the ozone layer, instead of Freon. Freon used to be the most common refrigerant till the 1980s; however, its use has declined since the 1990s because it comes under Chlorofluorocarbon (CFC). Ammonia was also used a a common refrigerant in old refrigerators. However, Freon still remains the most commonly used refrigerant. Hydrochlorofluorocarbon (HCFC), is a type of refrigerator coolant used in newer refrigerator models. The types used today include HFC-134a, HCFC-142b and HCFC-22.

questions.Question: Energy in reflected light :
questions.optionA: Does not depends on the angle of incidence
questions.optionB: Increases with the increase in angle
questions.optionC: Decreases with the increase in angle of incidence
questions.optionD: Becomes maximum for angle of incidence equal to 45°
questions.solution: Solution:		Reflected waves are simply those waves that are neither transmitted nor absorbed, but are reflected from the surface of the medium they encounter. The amount of incident-wave energy that is reflected from a surface depends on the nature of the surface and the angle at which the wave strikes the surface. The amount of wave energy reflected increases as the angle of incidence increases. The reflection of energy is the greatest when the wave is nearly parallel to the reflecting surface.

questions.Question: Which of these is true of all simple machines?
questions.solution: Solution:		Simple machine make work easier and work input > work output.

questions.Question: Which of these is not a simple machine?
questions.solution: Solution:		Any of the basic mechanical devices for applying a force are called simple machines. There are 6 basic simple machines; the lever, the wheel and axle, the inclined plane, the wedge, the pulley, and the screw. Several of these simple machines are related to each other. But, each has a specific purpose in the world of doing work. A pair of scissors is not a simple machine.

questions.Question: The plastic material commonly used for making gear wheels is
questions.solution: Solution:		The plastic material commonly used for making gear wheels is nylons.

questions.Question: The reason for a swimming pool to appear less deep than the actual depth is
questions.solution: Solution:		The apparent depth will look less that its real depth due to the refraction of light. Refraction is the bending of a wave when it enters a medium where it’s speed is different. The refraction of light when it passes from a fast medium to a slow medium bends the light ray toward the normal to the boundary between the two media. The amount of bending depends on the indices of refraction of the two media and is described quantitatively by Snell’s Law.

questions.Question: When light passes from one medium to another, this phenomenon of change in its direction is called ________
questions.solution: Solution:		When light passes from one medium to another, this phenomenon of change in its direction is called refraction.

questions.Question: Which tube used to produce X-ray?
questions.solution: Solution:		Coolidge tube is used to produce X-ray.

questions.Question: A Fuse wire is characterised by
questions.optionA: High resistance and low melting point
questions.optionB: High resistance and high melting point
questions.optionC: Low resistance and high melting point
questions.optionD: Low resistance and low melting point
questions.solution: Solution:		Fuse is a piece of wire of a material with a very low melting point. When a high current flows through the circuit due to overloading or a short circuit, the wires gets heated and melts. As a result,the circuit is broken and current stops flowing.

questions.Question: When the main switch of the house is put off it disconnects the
questions.optionB: Live wire and the earth wire
questions.optionC: Live wire and the neutral wire
questions.optionD: Earth wire and the neutral wire
questions.solution: Solution:		 It disconnects the live and neutral wire.

questions.Question: Electric power is measured in units of
questions.solution: Solution:		Electricity is measured in Watts and kilowatts.

questions.Question: Find the current (in A) when a charge of 500 Coulomb flows in 25 seconds.
questions.solution: Solution:		Current = Charge/Time I = Q/t I = 500/25 I = 20 A.

questions.Question: During uniform motion of an object along a straight line, its ________ remains constant with time.
questions.solution: Solution:		During uniform motion of an object along a straight line, its velocity remains constant with time.

questions.Question: Find the acceleration (in m/s2) of a body which accelerates from 25 m/s to 30 m/s in 10 seconds
questions.solution: Solution:		u(initial velocity) = 25m/s v(final velocity) = 30m/s t(time) = 10sa = (v-u)/t a = (30-25)/10 a = 5/10 a = 1/2 a = 0.5m/s²

questions.Question: Acceleration is
questions.solution: Solution:		Acceleration is directly proportional to force.

questions.Question: A tennis ball machine serves a ball vertically into the air from a height of 2 feet, with an initial speed of 110 feet per second. After how many seconds does the ball attain its maximum height?
questions.solution: Solution:		It is launched vertically with an initial speed of 110 ft/sec.It will reach maximum height when the speed drops to 0.Vo = 110 feet per secondho = 2 feetSo, h(t) = -16t^2 +110t +2 Take the derivative: h'(t) = 110 -32t The maximum height will be at the inflection when the derivative crosses the x-axis, then h'(t)=0. So, set h'(t)=0 and solve for t: 0 = 110 -32t -110 = -32t t = 3.4375 t = 3.44 seconds.

questions.Question: The motion of a freely falling body is an example of ________ motion.
questions.solution: Solution:		The motion of a freely falling body is an example of uniformly accelerated motion. The motion of the body where the acceleration is constant is known as uniformly accelerated motion.

questions.Question: A cyclist leans inwards when he is negotiating a curve so that
questions.optionC: Necessary centripetal force may be available from the horizontal component of the normal reaction due to the track to maintain the curved motion.
questions.optionD: No frictional force may be produced between the wheels and the axle
questions.solution: Solution:		The weight W, acts vertically downward and the normal force, N acts vertically upward. The frictional force, F, of the road acts horizontally in the direction of which the cyclist is turning. The frictional force provides the centripetal force necessary to turn the cyclist. But the frictional force also produces a torque that will cause the rider and bicycle to tip outwards. When the cyclist lean inwards the normal force of the road does not act through the center of gravity thus producing an opposite torque that cancels out the torque provided by the frictional force. Thus there is no tendency for the cyclist to tip outwards.

questions.Question: If an object is thrown upwards, what will be its velocity, when it reaches its maximum height?
questions.solution: Solution:		An object that is thrown vertically upwards decelerates under the earth's gravity. Its speed decreases until it attains a maximum height, where the velocity is zero.

questions.Question: Knot is a measure of
questions.solution: Solution:		Knot is a measure of the speed of ship.

questions.Question: A pilot has to release the bomb to hit a target
questions.solution: Solution:		According to Newton’s first law, an object that is at rest will stay at rest unless an unbalanced force acts upon it and an object that is in motion will not change its velocity unless an unbalanced force acts upon it. So the bomb carries the inertia of the aircraft and so has to be launched before the target so that it can hit it on time. Assuming the plane continues to fly straight forward, the plane will be directly over the target when the bomb hits.

questions.Question: What is the other name of Galileo's law of falling bodies?
questions.solution: Solution:		Newton's first law is the other name of Galileo's law of falling bodies.

questions.Question: A man standing at the top of a tower has two spheres A and B. He drops sphere A downwards and throws sphere B horizontally at the same time. Which of the following is correct ?
questions.optionA: Both the spheres will reach the ground simultaneously.
questions.optionB: A will reach the ground first.
questions.optionC: B will reach the ground first.
questions.optionD: The question is incomplete because the masses of the spheres are not given.
questions.solution: Solution:		If no air resistance is present, the rate of descent depends only on how far the object has fallen, no matter how heavy the object is. This means that two objects will reach the ground at the same time if they are dropped simultaneously from the same height. This statement follows from the law of conservation of energy.

questions.Question: Two stones of unequal masses are thrown vertically up with the same velocity. Which of the following will happen?
questions.optionA: The heavier mass will reach greater height
questions.optionB: The lighter mass will reach greater height
questions.optionC: Both will reach the same height
questions.optionD: Any of them may reach greater height
questions.solution: Solution:		Galileo’s experiment showed that if two bodies of unequal masses are dropped from the same height, the time required by them to reach the ground are equal. If they are thrown vertically upwards with the same initial velocity, then the ratio of the time required to reach the ground is equal to unity. This means that both of them will reach the same height.

questions.Question: The dimension of which of the following is the same as that of impulse ?
questions.optionD: Change in the rate of momentum
questions.solution: Solution:		Impulse has the same units and dimensions (MLT-1) as momentum.

questions.Question: An object covers distance which is directly proportional to the square of the time. Its accelaration is
questions.solution: Solution:		If an object covers distance in direct proportion to the square of the time elapsed, then the acceleration is constant.

questions.Question: A bullet of mass 10gm is fired with a velocity of 40 m/s from a gun of mass 8 kg. Find the recoil velocity (in m/s) of the gun.
questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: What is refractive index ?
questions.optionA: It is defined as the ratio of speed of light in the medium to the speed of light in vacuum.
questions.optionB: It is defined as the product of speed of light in medium and in vacuum.
questions.optionC: It is defined as the ratio of speed of light in vacuum to the speed of light in the medium.
questions.solution: Solution:		The ratio of the velocity of light in a vacuum to its velocity in a specified medium.

questions.Question: A star appears twinkling in the sky because of
questions.solution: Solution:		A star appears twinkling in the sky because of refraction of light by atmosphere.

questions.Question: What type of lens is used in a magnifying glass
questions.solution: Solution:		Convex lens is used in magnifying glass.

questions.Question: Time of exposure required for taking photograph of an object depends upon the
questions.solution: Solution:		The total exposure is proportional to this exposure time, or duration of light reaching the film or image sensor. The correct exposure for a particular object depends on the brightness of the object to be photographed.

questions.Question: A concave lens always forms
questions.optionC: An image type which depends on object characteristics
questions.optionD: An image type which depends on lens curvature
questions.solution: Solution:		A concave lens always forms a virtual image.

questions.Question: Find the resistance (in mega) of a wire of length 20m, cross sectional area 1 cm2 and made of a material of resistivity 200m.
questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: A copper wire of radius r and length l has a resistance of R. A second copper wire with radius 2r and length l is taken and the two wires are joined in a parallel combination. The resultant resistance of the parallel combination of the two wires will be
questions.solution: Solution:		1st copper wire: R = pl/A = pl/ πr22ndcopper wire: R’ = p’l’/A’ = pl/(4 πr2) = R/4If joined in parallel, (1/Req) = (1/R) + (1/R’)= 1/R + 4/R = 5/RReq = R/5

questions.Question: Which of the following is a good conductor of heat but a bad conductor of electricity ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Mica is a good conductor of heat but bad conductor of electricity.

questions.Question: When a number of resistors are connected in series in a circuit, the value of current:
questions.solution: Solution:		The same current flows through each resistor in series. Individual resistors in series do not get the total source voltage, but divide it. The total resistance in a series circuit is equal to the sum of the individual resistances: RN(series)=R1+R2+R3+… +RN.

questions.Question: A good conductor while carrying current is
questions.solution: Solution:		Electrons carry current in a good conductor of electricity and they are negatively charged. This makes a good electrical conductor negatively charged.

questions.Question: An oil drop spreads over water because
questions.optionC: Oil does not mix with water
questions.optionD: water has a higher surface tension
questions.solution: Solution:		Surface tension of oil is smaller than that of water. When oil is dropped on the surface of water, the force stretches the oil drops on all sides. Hence the oil spreads over the surface of water.

questions.Question: Rotameter is used to measure
questions.solution: Solution:		Rotameter is used to measure flow of fluids.

questions.Question: Siphon will fail to work if
questions.optionA: The level of the liquid in the two vessels are at the same height
questions.optionB: The temperature of the liquids in the two vessels are the same
questions.optionC: The densities of the liquid in the two vessels are equal
questions.optionD: Both its limbs are of unequal length
questions.solution: Solution:		Siphon will fail to work if the level of the liquid in the two vessels are at the same height. Siphon is a tube bent to form two legs of unequal length by which a liquid can be transferred from a reservoir and then down to a lower level of it.

questions.Question: Sprayer functions on
questions.solution: Solution:		Bernoulli’s principle states that as the speed of a moving fluid (liquid or gas) increases, the pressure within the liquid decreases. In the case of a sprayer, when the plunger is pushed in, the air flows at a high velocity through a nozzle, creating a region of low pressure above the metal tube. The higher pressure of the atmospheric air causes the liquid to rise up to the metal tube and come out as spray.

questions.Question: A drop of liquid assumes spherical shape because:
questions.optionA: Intermolecular forces are strong in liquids
questions.optionB: A sphere has the least surface area for a given volume
questions.optionC: A sphere has the largest surface area for a given volume
questions.optionD: Inter molecular forces are weak in liquids
questions.solution: Solution:		A drop of liquid assumes spherical shape because a sphere has the least surface area for a given volume.

questions.Question: Which is an example of Phototropism?
questions.optionA: Roots of a plant following water
questions.optionD: A venus flytrap capturing a fly
questions.solution: Solution:		 Sunflowers are a great example of positive phototropism, because not only do their stems curve toward the light but their flowers turn to face the sunlight as well.

questions.Question: Light travels fastest in
questions.solution: Solution:		Light travels fastest in air.

questions.Question: Light travels slowest in
questions.solution: Solution:		The indexes of refraction for diamond, air and glass are, respectively, 2.42, 1.00, and approximately 1.50, depending upon the composition of the glass. Light travels slowest in diamond.

questions.Question: Light from the sun reaches us in nearly
questions.solution: Solution:		The light from the sun takes about 8 minutes to reach the Earth after it has been emitted from the sun's surface. The time it takes for light to reach planets in our Solar System varies from about 3 minutes for Mercury to about 5.3 hours for Pluto.

questions.Question: An image formed by a plane mirror, that cannot be obtained on a screen is called ________
questions.solution: Solution:		A virtual image is formed when reflected rays appear to meet. Such images cannot be obtained on screen. Plane mirrors, convex mirror and concave lens always forms virtual image.

questions.Question: Pure water is bad conductor of electricity because it is
questions.solution: Solution:		Pure water is a bad conductor of electricity. Pure water does not contain any impurities or ions resulting in neutral ions present in it. In the absence of electrons no solution or water can conduct electricity as ions carry electric charge and conduct electricity.

questions.Question: The metal whose electrical conductivity is more, is
questions.solution: Solution:		The most electrically conductive metal is silver.

questions.Question: Which of the following is a conductor of electricity ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Salt water is a conductor of electricity.

questions.Question: A bird sitting on a high tension electric wire does not get electrocuted because
questions.optionC: It does not form a closed path for the flow of current
questions.solution: Solution:		Birds don't get electrocuted on power lines because electricity does not move through their bodies when they sit on them. When the bird sits with both its feet on the electrical wire, their legs have an equal electrical potential so the electricity will not move throughout the bird's body.

questions.Question: The fuse in our domestic electric circuit melts when there is a high rise in
questions.solution: Solution:		The fuse in our domestic electric circuit melts when there is a high rise in current.

questions.Question: Heat is transmitted from higher temperature to lower temperature through the actual motion of the molecules in
questions.solution: Solution:		Heat is transferred in the liquid and gases from a region of higher temperature to a region of lower temperature. Convection heat transfer occurs partly due to the actual movement of molecules or due to the mass transfer.

questions.Question: Energy travels from Sun to Earth through
questions.solution: Solution:		Energy travels from Sun to Earth through radiation.

questions.Question: Which best describes how air moves during convection?
questions.optionC: Cool air is replaced by warm air
questions.solution: Solution:		In convection, hot air rises from the Earth's surface and becomes cold at higher altitude because of lower temperature there. As it cools, it sinks down to the surface of the Earth. On reaching Earth, it warms again and rises up again. The main reason for this phenomenon is - sinking cold air pushes the warm air up.

questions.Question: When does land breeze occur?
questions.solution: Solution:		Land breeze occur during fall and winter.

questions.Question: The cooling by a desert Cooler is based on:
questions.solution: Solution:		Desert coolers are based on the simple principle that when unsaturated air comes in contact with water, the water evaporates. In the process, the moisture content of air increases, while its temperature decreases. The resulting cold but moist air is used for providing cooling.

questions.Question: A tank filled partially with a liquid is subjected to a uniform horizontal acceleration. Which of the following is true for the surface of liquid in the tank?
questions.optionA: The liquid surface falls down on the direction of motion and rises up on the back side of the tank
questions.optionB: The liquid surface falls down only at the center of the tank
questions.optionC: The surface of the liquid remains horizontal
questions.solution: Solution:		The liquid surface falls down on the direction of motion and rises up on the back side of the tank.

questions.Question: The lift of an aeroplane is caused by
questions.solution: Solution:		The lift of an aeroplane is caused by Bernouli's theorem.

questions.Question: Which of the following instrument is used to measure Soil Water Tension?
questions.solution: Solution:		Tensiometer is used to measure Soil Water Tension.

questions.Question: Blotting paper absorbs ink due to
questions.optionB: Diffusion of ink through the blotting
questions.solution: Solution:		Blotting paper absorbs ink by the process of capillary action. The capillary action is based on the property of surface tension of liquid. All unsized paper will absorb water. Blotting paper is not sized and made bulkier to provide capillary action for faster absorption of liquid. Blotting paper has also been sold as a cosmetic to aid in the removal of skin oils and makeup.

questions.Question: Name the process by which bubbles from liquid are formed?
questions.solution: Solution:		Effervescence is the escape of gas from an aqueous solution and the foaming or fizzing that results from a release of the gas. It leads to the formation of gas bubbles in a liquid. For example, when opening a bottle of champagne, beer or carbonated beverages such as soft drinks, the visible bubbles are produced by the escape from solution of the dissolved gas.

questions.Question: Which of the following is arranged in order of decreasing conductivity?
questions.solution: Solution:		Silver, Copper, Aluminium, Steel is arranged in order of decreasing conductivity.

questions.Question: Every hot object emits ________
questions.solution: Solution:		Every hot object emits infrared rays.

questions.Question: Which metal is the best conductor of heat?
questions.solution: Solution:		Copper is the best conductor of heat.

questions.Question: When hot liquid is poured into a thick glass tumbler, it cracks because glass :
questions.optionA: Is a bad conductor of heat so only inner surface expands
questions.optionB: Has high temperature coefficient of expansion
questions.optionC: Has a very low specific heat
questions.optionD: Has low temperature coefficient of expansion
questions.solution: Solution:		When hot liquid is poured into a thick glass tumbler, it cracks because glass is a bad conductor of heat so only inner surface expands.

questions.Question: Mud houses are cooler in summers and warmer in winters as compared to brick houses because
questions.optionD: Evaporation of water causes cooling in summers and sunlight coming through holes causes warming in winters
questions.solution: Solution:		Clay is a poor conductor of heat as compared to wood and bricks. Therefore, clay neither allows the external heat to enter the house in summer nor it allows the internal heat to escape out in winters. Hence, mud houses remain colder in summer and warmer in winter. mud or clay is poor conductor of electricity.

questions.Question: The unit of force is a
questions.solution: Solution:		The unit of force is a derived unit.

questions.Question: Atmospheric pressure exerted on earth is due to
questions.solution: Solution:		Atmospheric pressure is caused by the gravitational attraction of the planet on the atmospheric gases above the surface, and is a function of the mass of the planet, the radius of the surface, and the amount and composition of the gases and their vertical distribution in the atmosphere.

questions.Question: What is the SI unit of Force?
questions.solution: Solution:		SI unit of force is Newton.

questions.Question: What measures Air pressure?
questions.solution: Solution:		Barometer measures air pressure.

questions.Question: The rice is cooked more quickly in a pressure cooker because
questions.optionB: Less quantity of water is used.
questions.optionD: Water boils at a higher temperature under pressure.
questions.solution: Solution:		Food is cooked more quickly in a pressure cooker because at the higher pressure (1 bar/15 psi), the boiling point of water rises from 100°C (212°F) to 121°C (250°F). The hotter steam is able to transmit its thermal energy to the food at around 4 times the rate of conventional boiling.

questions.Question: A hydrogen balloon floats up because of
questions.optionA: Air pressure decreases with decrease in height
questions.optionB: Air pressure decreases with decrease in weight
questions.optionC: Weight of the balloon is less than the weight of air displaced by it.
questions.optionD: The pressure inside the balloon is more than the pressure outside it
questions.solution: Solution:		The balloon has to displace some air, so in response, the air pushes up on it. But hydrogen is less dense than air, so the air pushes up on the balloon harder than gravity is pulling it down, and the balloon tries to move up. So just like wood float on water, hydrogen balloons float on air.

questions.Question: A boat will submerge when it displaces water equal to its own:
questions.solution: Solution:		A boat will float when the weight of the water it displaces equals the weight of the boat and anything will float if it is shaped to displace its own weight of water before it reaches the point where it will submerge.

questions.Question: What is the principle of a ''Life Jacket"?
questions.optionA: It provides oxygen to a drowning person
questions.optionB: It increases the volume of the person to keep him afloat
questions.optionC: It decreases the volume of the person to keep him afloat
questions.optionD: The person can sit on it like a raft
questions.solution: Solution:		The upward-pushing force that keeps things afloat is called buoyancy. For an object to float it must be able to equal its own weight by displacing enough water. A life jacket is mainly filled with gas which has a very low mass. As such when worn by a person, it acts to significantly increase their volume for only a very small increase in their mass. This means that they have a lower density than normal which increases their buoyancy and helps them to float.

questions.Question: When a piece of stone is immersed in water, it displaces water of equal
questions.solution: Solution:		Archimedes’ Principle states that upward buoyant force exerted on a body immersed in a fluid is equal to the weight of the fluid the body displaces.

questions.Question: It is easier for a man to swim in sea water, than in river water because
questions.optionA: The density of sea water is lesser than the density of river water
questions.optionB: The density of sea water is more than the density of river water
questions.optionC: The sea is-deeper than the river
questions.optionD: The sea is wider than the river
questions.solution: Solution:		It is easier for a man to swim in sea water, than in river water because sea water contains more amount of salt as compared to river/fresh water as a result its density increases and hence the buoyant force increases which makes it easier to swim in sea water.

questions.Question: Lux is the SI unit of
questions.solution: Solution:The SI unit of intensity of illumination (illuminance) is the lux. An illuminance of 1.0 lux is produced by 1.0 lumen of light shining on an area of 1.0 m2.

questions.Question: On a rainy day, small oil films on water show brilliant colours. This is due to
questions.solution: Solution:		On a rainy day, small oil films on water show brilliant colours. This is due to Interference. Interference is a phenomenon in which two waves superimpose to form a resultant wave of greater, lower or same amplitude.

questions.Question: Point A is at a lower electrical potential  than point B. An electron between them on the line joining them will
questions.optionC: Move at right angles to the line joining A and B
questions.solution: Solution:		Since we know that electric currents move from a higher potential or a lower potential. Also, electrons move in the direction opposite to electric current. So the electron on the line joining two points A and B will move from lower to higher potential i.e, it will move towards B.

questions.Question: Materials for rain-proof coats and tents owe their water-proof properties to
questions.solution: Solution:		The material of rain proof coats have the property of not minimizing the surface tension which will tend the water molecule to be in its drop form.

questions.Question: RADAR is used for:
questions.optionB: receiving a signals in a radio receiver.
questions.optionD: detecting and locating the position of objects such as Aeroplanes.
questions.solution: Solution:		RADAR is used for detecting and locating the position of objects such as Aeroplanes.

questions.Question: Out of the following pairs, choose the pair in which the physical quantities do not have identical dimension?
questions.optionD: Force and rate of change of linear momentum
questions.solution: Solution:Impulse and moment of force.

questions.Question: If two bodies of different masses, initially at rest, are acted upon by the same force for the same time, then the both bodies acquire the same:
questions.solution: Solution:		Since the Force and the duration of time for which it acted are same, the product of force and time will be the same for both. Since Force×time gives change in momentum of a body, and they had 0 momentum initially, their final momenta will be same.

questions.Question: Pick out the scalar quantity
questions.solution: Solution:		Pressure is a scalar quantity.

questions.Question: Rectifiers are used to convert:
questions.solution: Solution:		A rectifier is an electrical device that converts alternating current (AC), which periodically reverses direction, to direct current (DC), which flows in only one direction. The process is known as rectification, since it "straightens" the direction of current.

questions.Question: Out of the following, which is not emitted by  radioactive substance?
questions.solution: Solution:		Out of the following neutrons is not emitted by radioactive substance.

questions.Question: If the diameter of a capillary is doubled, then the rise of water in it will be
questions.solution: Solution:		Radius of a capillary tube is inversely proportional to the height of the liquid column. So, if radius of the tube is doubled, rise of level of water will becomes half of the previous rise in capillary tube. Capillary action, or capillarity, is the ability of a liquid to flow in narrow spaces without the assistance of, and in opposition to external forces like gravity. The effect can be seen in the drawing up of liquids between the hairs of a paint-brush, in a thin tube, in porous materials such as paper, in some non-porous materials such as liquefied carbon fiber, or in a cell. It occurs because of inter-molecular attractive forces between the liquid and solid surrounding surfaces.

questions.Question: A needle or a pin floats on the surface of water because of
questions.solution: Solution:		The pin or needle floats because of an invisible elastic skin on the surface of the water. This elastic skin is called surface tension. Surface tension of the water leads to forces strong enough to support the needle’s weight.

questions.Question: Materials for rain proof coats and tents owe their water proof properties to
questions.solution: Solution:		Materials for rain proof coats and tents owe their water proof properties to Surface Tension. The surface of a liquid behaves like an elastic membrane and therefore, has a tendency to contract. This property of liquid is called Surface Tension.

questions.Question: Soap bubble attains spherical shape due to ________
questions.solution: Solution:		Soap bubble attains spherical shape due to surface tension.

questions.Question: Water drops cannot stick to the oily surface due to
questions.solution: Solution:		The separation of oil and water is caused due to the difference in surface tension of the two liquids. The water molecules stick together tightly and does not mix with the oil because water molecules are attracted to each other very strongly, forming an invisible “skin” of surface tension around each drop.

questions.Question: Which alternative energy source is exhaustible?
questions.solution: Solution:		The alternative energy source which is exhaustible is geothermal energy.

questions.Question: Which of the following is a Non Renewable Resource of Energy?
questions.solution: Solution:		Most non-renewable energy sources are fossil fuels: coal, petroleum, and natural gas. Carbon is the main element in fossil fuels. For this reason, the time period that fossil fuels formed (about 360-300 million years ago) is called the Carboniferous Period.

questions.Question: Which of the following is a renewable resource of energy?
questions.solution: Solution:		All of the above are renewable resource of energy.

questions.Question: The group of solar cells joined together in a definite pattern is called a
questions.solution: Solution:		A single solar cell can produce only a small amount of electricity. In those cases where more electrical power is needed, a large number of solar cells are joined in series. This group of solar cells is called a ‘solar cell panel’. Thus, a solar cell panel consists of a large number of solar cells joined together in a definite pattern.

questions.Question: Which of the following uses a Non Renewable Energy Source?
questions.solution: Solution:		Nuclear Power Plant uses a Non Renewable Energy Source.

questions.Question: The atmospheric air is held to the Earth by :
questions.solution: Solution:		Surface gravity, the force that holds down an atmosphere, differs significantly among the planets.

questions.Question: The pressure of a fluid varies with depth h as P = PQ+pgh, where p is the fluid density. This expression is associated with
questions.solution: Solution:		The pressure of a fluid varies with depth h as P = PQ+pgh, where p is the fluid density. This expression is associated with Pascal's law.

questions.Question: A parachute descends slowly whereas a stone dropped from the same height falls rapidly, because
questions.optionB: Special mechanisms are present in parachute
questions.optionC: A parachute has a larger surface area and air resistance is more
questions.solution: Solution:		Gravity is pulling the man down while friction with the air slows him down. With the parachute out it adds more friction slowing him down because air resistance works against the very large surface area of the parachute. A free falling skydiver that has not yet opened his parachute can make his downward speed vary between about 110 mph and 225 mph using air resistance. A spread eagled position presents the maximum area, and we fall the slowest.

questions.Question: Why does bleeding occur through the nose in high mountainous regions ?
questions.optionA: The pressure of blood in capillaries is greater than the outside pressure
questions.optionB: The pressure at high altitudes is greater than that on the plains
questions.optionC: The blood pressure of a person increases at high altitudes
questions.optionD: The blood pressure fluctuates and finally decreases drastically
questions.solution: Solution:		Nosebleeds can be caused by being up in a very high altitude. As you climb higher, the amount of oxygen in the air decreases. This makes the air thinner and dryer, which can in turn cause the inside of your nose to crack and bleed.

questions.Question: Which of the following instruments is used to measure humidity ?
questions.solution: Solution:		A hygrometer is an instrument used to measure relative humidity. Humidity is the measure of the amount of moisture in the air. A psychrometer is an example of a hygrometer.

questions.Question: In which of the following industries is mica as a raw material?
questions.solution: Solution:		In electrical industries mica is used as a raw material.

questions.Question: Radiocarbon dating technique is used to estimate the age of
questions.solution: Solution:		Radiocarbon dating involves determining the age of an ancient fossil or specimen by measuring its carbon-14 content. Carbon-14, or radiocarbon, is a naturally occurring radioactive isotope that forms when cosmic rays in the upper atmosphere strike nitrogen molecules, which then oxidize to become carbon dioxide.

questions.Question: Identify the vector quantity from the following
questions.solution: Solution:		Angular momentum is a vector quantity.

questions.Question: Large astronomical telescopes always use as objective
questions.solution: Solution:		Large astronomical telescopes always use as objective combination of lenses.

questions.Question: One should not connect a number of electrical appliances to the same power socket because
questions.optionA: this can damage the appliances due to overloading
questions.optionB: this can damage the domestic wiring due to overloading
questions.optionC: this can damage the electrical meter
questions.optionD: the appliance will not get full voltage
questions.solution: Solution:		If we connect many appliances to the same socket, requirement of current for that socket will increase, the wire connected to that socket will have to supply more current, that may exceed its current rating and can damage it.

questions.Question: The density of water is 1 g/cc. This is strictly valid at
questions.solution: Solution:		The density of water is 1 g/cc. This is strictly valid at 4°C.

questions.Question: Specific gravity is defined as the ratio of
questions.optionA: Density of the substance to the density of water
questions.optionB: Density of the substance to the density of water at 0°C
questions.optionC: Density of water at 4°C to the density of the substance
questions.optionD: Density of the substance to the density of water at 4°C
questions.solution: Solution:		Specific gravity is defined as the ratio of density of the substance to the density of water.

questions.Question: The cause for the Tsunami, as deduced by the seismologists, is
questions.optionB: Low pressure trough in the ocean
questions.optionC: Deformation of sea floor and vertical displacement of water
questions.optionD: Sudden change in the monsoon wind
questions.solution: Solution:		Seismologists say only earthquakes measuring greater than 7.0 on the Richter scale can produce a major tsunami. The friction between two slow-moving plates of the Earth's crust creates vast amounts of seismic energy which is released in the form of an earthquake.

questions.Question: Which statement best describes an igneous intrusion?
questions.optionA: Igneous intrusion for when ice crystals splash into lava
questions.optionB: Magma is injected into surrounding rock forming an igneous intrusive
questions.optionC: Magma is exported to an open area and forms iron
questions.optionD: Magma explodes to the surface and forms a smooth outer layer of rock
questions.solution: Solution:		Magma is injected into surrounding rock forming an igneous intrusive is the statement that best describe an igneous intrusion.

questions.Question: Which is a common first indicator of an approaching thunderstorm?
questions.solution: Solution:		They usually appear as swift-moving black clouds, often approaching from the northwest southwest, south or west at speeds of 25-35 knots. You can determine the distance of an approaching thunderstorm by counting the number of seconds between the lightning flash and the thunder clap, and dividing by five.

questions.Question: The phenomenon of change in direction of light when it passes from one medium to another is called
questions.solution: Solution:		The phenomenon of change in direction of light when it passes from one medium to another is called refraction.

questions.Question: The refractive index of a transparent medium is maximum for
questions.solution: Solution:		The refractive index of a transparent medium is most for violet light. The reason is that the speed of violet light is least in a transparent medium while the speed of red light is most in transparent medium.

questions.Question: What type of lens is a magnifying glass?
questions.solution: Solution:		A magnifying glass (called a hand lens in laboratory contexts) is a convex or converging lens that is used to produce a magnified image of an object. The lens is usually mounted in a frame with a handle.

questions.Question: Which of the following is not caused by atmospheric refraction of light ?
questions.optionC: Sun appearing higher in the sky than it actually is
questions.optionD: Sun becoming visible two or three minutes before actual sunrise
questions.solution: Solution:		The twinkling of stars and variation in size of the Sun are due to atmospheric refraction of light. Besides, refraction is also responsible for the sun to look during sunset and sunrise. It is also responsible for the sun becoming two or three minutes before actual sunrise. The sun appears higher or lower in the sky due to the changing position of the Earth relative to the Sun.

questions.Question: Why does water tank appear shallower when viewed from the top?
questions.solution: Solution:		The bending of light (i.e. refraction of light) as it moves from water to air makes the water tank appear to be less shallower than its real depth.

questions.Question: If a copper wire is increased to double its length, its resistance will become
questions.solution: Solution:		When the wire is stretched to double the length , the area of cross section gets reduced to half. So when the wire is stretched, the resistance multiplies by four times.

questions.Question: The filament of electric bulb is made up of :
questions.solution: Solution:		The filament of an electric bulb is made of tungsten because it has some amazing properties including the highest melting point (3422oC), lowest vapor pressure, and greatest tensile strength out of all the metals.

questions.Question: Full form of CFL used in place of electric bulbs is
questions.solution: Solution:		A compact fluorescent lamp (CFL), also called compact fluorescent light, energy-saving light and compact fluorescent tube, is a fluorescent lamp designed to replace an incandescent light bulb; some types fit into light fixtures designed for incandescent bulbs.

questions.Question: Two electric bulbs marked 25W – 220V and 100W – 220V are connected in series to a 440Vsupply. Which of the bulbs will fuse?
questions.solution: Solution:		When connected in series, the voltages divide in them in the ratio of their resistances. The voltage of 440 V devides in such a way that voltage across 25 w bulb will be more than 220 V. Hence 25 w bulb will fuse.

questions.Question: 1 WH =
questions.solution: Solution:		1 WH (Watt hour) = 3600 joules

questions.Question: Velocitation is the tendency to
questions.optionA: Be traveling at a speed that is faster than perceived
questions.optionB: Be traveling at a speed that is slower than perceived
questions.solution: Solution:		Velocitation is a phenomenon caused by driving for long periods at high speeds. A driver may experience velocitation when coming off of the highway; the change in speed makes him or her think that the car is going much slower than it actually is. Velocitation is the tendency to be traveling at a speed that is faster than perceived.

questions.Question: If the velocity-time graph of a particle is represented by y = mt + c, then the particle is moving with
questions.solution: Solution:		In this case the given equation shows that that the velocity is linear with time and therefore the particle is moving with constant acceleration because for a particle to acquire constant acceleration the graph of the velocity time graph should be in linear with the time function.

questions.Question: Which one of the following is applicable to collision-coalescence process of precipitation?
questions.optionA: Clouds which do not extend beyond the freezing level
questions.optionB: Clouds which extend beyond the freezing level
questions.solution: Solution:		In colder clouds: droplets formed by Bergeron mechanism. But, in many parts of the world the air is too warm for ice crystals to form. This being the case, rain and snow cannot develop following the Bergeron Process. Instead, tiny droplets form as they collide into one another creating larger and larger droplet, this is known as collision-coalescence process. So, warmer clouds are associated with this keyword.

questions.Question: The law of conservation of energy states that
questions.optionA: Energy can neither be created nor destroyed
questions.optionB: Energy can either be created nor destroyed
questions.optionC: Energy can neither be created or destroyed
questions.optionD: Energy can either be created or destroyed
questions.solution: Solution:		The law of conservation of energy states that energy can neither be created nor destroyed.

questions.Question: A hunter on the ground wishes to shoot a bird on a tree at a distance with his rifle. He has to point the rifle
questions.optionA: At the lower elevation than the bird
questions.optionB: At a higher elevation than the bird
questions.optionC: In the same direction as the bird
questions.solution: Solution:		A hunter on the ground wishes to shoot a bird on a tree at a distance with his rifle. He has to point the rifle at a higher elevation than the bird.

questions.Question: If the distance between Sun and Earth becomes double, then the gravitational force on Earth will be
questions.solution: Solution:		If the distance is doubled, the force of gravity is one-fourth as strong as before.

questions.Question: The large collection of stars, dust and gas held together by gravitational attraction between components is known as
questions.solution: Solution:		The term galaxy refers to a large collection of stars, dust, and gas clouds which are held together by gravitational attraction.The smallest galaxies may contain only a few hundred thousand stars, while the largest galaxies have thousands of billions of stars. The Milky Way galaxy contains our solar system.

questions.Question: A person can jump higher on the moon's surface than on the earth because :
questions.optionB: The acceleration due to gravity in moon is smaller than that on the earth.
questions.optionC: The moon is cooler than earth
questions.solution: Solution:		Earth's gravity is 6 times moon's gravity. That means moon attracts an object with less force than earth. Hence a person can jump higher on moon than on earth.

questions.Question: The velocity required to place a vehicle in orbit around the moon is ________ that required to place it in orbit round the earth.
questions.solution: Solution:		The velocity required to place a vehicle in orbit around the moon is less than required to place it in orbit round the earth.

questions.Question: Which measurement depends on gravitational force?
questions.solution: Solution:		Weight is a measure of force that is equal to the gravitational pull on an object. Mass is independent of location, while weight depends on location.

questions.Question: For which of the following substances, the resistance decreases with increase in temperature?
questions.solution: Solution:		The resistance decreases with increase in temperature for nichrome.

questions.Question: The S.I. unit of electric charge is :
questions.solution: Solution:		Electric charge has the dimension electric current time. The SI derived unit of electric charge is the coulomb, which is defined as an ampere second.

questions.Question: Indicate the false statement about the resistance of a wire
questions.optionA: It depends on material of wire
questions.optionB: It is directly proportional to the length of wire
questions.optionC: It is directly proportional to the area of cross-section of wire
questions.optionD: Resistance of metallic wire increases with increase in temperature
questions.solution: Solution:		It is directly proportional to the area of cross-section of wire is a false statement.

questions.Question: The magnitude of current flowing between two end points of a conductor is proportional to the potential difference between them and is called as:
questions.solution: Solution:		According to Ohm’s Law, the potential difference (V) between two terminals of a current-carrying conductor is directly proportional to the current (I), flowing through it. The proportionality constant R, is the resistance of the conductor. Thus, V α I or V = I × R or I = V/R or R = V/I.

questions.Question: What is the SI unit of electric current?
questions.solution: Solution:		SI unit of electric current is Ampere.

questions.Question: A light year is a measure of :
questions.solution: Solution:		A light year is a measure of distance.

questions.Question: The time period of a seconds pendulum is
questions.solution: Solution:		A seconds pendulum is a pendulum whose period is precisely two seconds; one second for a swing in one direction and one second for the return swing, a frequency of 12 Hz.

questions.Question: One billionth of a second is called
questions.solution: Solution:		A nanosecond (ns) is an SI unit of time equal to one billionth of a second.

questions.Question: Which one of the following is the value of one nanometer?
questions.solution: Solution:		One nanometer is equal to 10-7 cm.

questions.Question: If the length of a simple pendulum is halved then its period of oscillation is
questions.solution: Solution:		The time period of a pendulum is directly proportional to the square root of its length. So, if the length increases, its time period also increase. It means that it takes longer to complete one oscillation. So when its length is halved, its time period is decreased by a factor of 2.

questions.Question: The mass of a star is two times the mass of the Sun. How it will come to an end ?
questions.solution: Solution:		The mass of a star which is two times the mass of the sun turns into a neutron star. A neutron star is a type of stellar remnant that can result from the gravitational collapse of a massive star during a Type II, Type Ib or Type Ic supernova event. Such stars are composed almost entirely of neutrons, which are subatomic particles without electrical charge and with slightly larger mass than protons. Neutron stars are very hot and are supported against further collapse by quantum degeneracy pressure due to the Pauli’s exclusion principle. This principle states that no two neutrons (or any other fermionic particles) can occupy the same place and quantum state simultaneously. A typical neutron star has a mass between about 1.4 and 3.2 solar masses ( Chandrasekhar Limit), with a corresponding radius of about 12 km if the Akmal– Pandharipande–Ravenhall equation of state (APR EOS) is used.

questions.Question: Which of the following celestial bodies contains abundant quantities of helium-3, a potential source of energy ?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Moon has been bombarded with large quantities of Helium-3 by the solar wind.

questions.Question: The period of revolution of a certain planet in an orbit of radius R is T. Its period of revolution in an orbit of radius 4R will be:
questions.solution: Solution:		The period of revolution of a certain planet in an orbit of radius R is T. Its period of revolution in an orbit of radius 4R will be 8T.

questions.Question: Which is evidence that supports the dynamo theory?
questions.optionA: Earth's outer core contains liquid that conducts electricity
questions.optionB: Earth's core contains a large amount of iron
questions.optionD: Convection occurs in Earth's inner core
questions.solution: Solution:		In physics, the dynamo theory proposes a mechanism by which a celestial body such as Earth or a star generates a magnetic field. Earth's crust core contains a large amount of iron and nickel is the evidence of the dynamo theory.

questions.Question: Which of the following is indicated by the colour of a star ?
questions.solution: Solution:		The color of a star mostly indicates a star's temperature, and it can also suggest the star's age. Class O stars, which are blue in color, are the hottest, and class M stars, which are red in color, are the coldest.

questions.Question: ML2T-2 is the dimensional formula for
questions.solution: Solution:		ML2T-2 is the dimensional formula for couple acting on a body.

questions.Question: Solar eclipse will take place when
questions.optionA: the sun is between the moon and the earth
questions.optionB: the earth is between the moon and the sun
questions.optionC: the moon is between the sun and the earth
questions.optionD: the moon does not lie on the line joining the sun and the earth
questions.solution: Solution:		Solar eclipse will take place when the moon is between the sun and the earth.

questions.Question: Isotopes of an element contain
questions.optionA: the same number of protons but different number of neutrons
questions.optionB: the same number of neutrons but different number of protons
questions.optionC: equal number of protons and electrons
questions.solution: Solution:		Isotopes are atoms of the same element that have different numbers of neutrons but the same number of protons and electrons. The difference in the number of neutrons between the various isotopes of an element means that the various isotopes have different masses.

questions.Question: One watt-hour is equivalent to
questions.solution: Solution:		One watt-hour is equivalent to3.6 x 103 J

questions.Question: Sir C.V. Raman was awarded Nobel Prize for his work connected with which of the following phenomenon of radiation?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Nobel Prize in Physics 1930 was awarded to Sir Chandrasekhara Venkata Raman "for his work on the scattering of light and for the discovery of the effect named after him."

questions.Question: Heat flows as a result of difference of ________
questions.solution: Solution:		Heat flows as a result of difference of temperature.

questions.Question: Light beam which is highly directional is called:
questions.solution: Solution:		Light beam which is highly directional is called laser.

questions.Question: Speed of light is maximum in ________
questions.solution: Solution:		Light travels faster in vacuum as compared to any other medium. This is because there is no obstruction in the propagation of light in vacuum as there is no matter in vacuum and also, because the refractive index of vacuum is the lowest i.e. equal to unity.

questions.Question: Light travels in a straight line (rectilinear propagation of light). This statement does hold if the medium of travel for light is
questions.optionB: Made up of slabs of different refractive indices
questions.solution: Solution:		Light travels in a straight line (rectilinear propagation of light). This statement does hold if the medium of travel for light is homogeneous and transparent.

questions.Question: The speed of light will be minimum while passing through
questions.solution: Solution:		Light travels at approximately 300,000 kilometers per second in a vacuum, which has a refractive index of 1.0, but it slows down to 225,000 kilometers per second in water and 200,000 kilometers per second in glass.

questions.Question: The odometer guage indicates
questions.optionA: The distance travelled by a vehicle
questions.solution: Solution:		The odometer or the odograph is an instrument used to indicate the distance travelled by the vehicle

questions.Question: If a force acts upon two objects at rest, and having different masses for the same amount of time, then which one of the following will be the same for both the objects?
questions.solution: Solution:		If the same force is applied on two bodies of different masses for the same time, then the change produced in the momentum of the two bodies is also same .

questions.Question: Consider the following statements :1. There is no net moment on a body which is in equilibrium.2. The momentum of a body is always conserved.3. The kinetic energy of an object is always conserved.Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
questions.solution: Solution:		There is no net moment on a body which is in equilibrium and the momentum of a body is always conserved both are correct.

questions.Question: The rate of change of linear momentum of a body falling freely under gravity is equal to it's ________ ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Rate of change of impulse equals the force . In case of freely falling body the only force is the weight.

questions.Question: According to the theory of relativity, which of the following always remains constant ?
questions.solution: Solution:		The theory of relativity, or simply relativity, generally encompasses two theories of Albert Einstein: special relativity and general relativity. Concepts introduced by the theories of relativity include: Measurements of various quantities are relative to the velocities of observers. In particular, space and time can dilate. Space time: space and time should be considered together and in relation to each other. The speed of light is nonetheless invariant, the same for all observers.

questions.Question: Ball pen functions on the principle of :
questions.solution: Solution:		The ballpoint pen is one of the most simple and yet ubiquitous devices whose function depends on surface tension. With a pen held upright, gravity and surface tension act in concert to get ink onto the ball.

questions.Question: When a detergent is added to pure water, its surface tension
questions.solution: Solution:		When detergent is added to water, it decreases the surface tension of the water. Compounds that lower water's surface tension are called surfactants, which work by separating the water molecules from one another.

questions.Question: Pieces of camphor placed on water move about rapidly. This is because of
questions.solution: Solution:		The Camphor slowly dissolves in the water lowering the latter's surface tension in the immediate neighbourhood. The stronger pull exerted by the uncontaminated portion of water brings about a movement of the surface and the camphor particles are carried along with it. When after sometime the whole surface settles for the reduced tension, the movement of the camphor too short.

questions.Question: What is unit of Viscosity ?
questions.optionC: Watt per meter per degree celcius
questions.solution: Solution:		The SI unit of dynamic viscosity is the newton-second per square meter.

questions.Question: The hair of shaving brush clings together when removed from water due to
questions.solution: Solution:		When the brush is taken out of water, the hairs cling together due to surface tension. This happens because the free surface of water tries to acquire a minimum surface area.

questions.Question: The fuse in an electric circuit is connected in
questions.solution: Solution:		Fuses are always connected in series with the components to be protected from overcurrent, so that when the fuse blows (opens) it will open the entire circuit and stop current through the components.

questions.Question: Working of safety fuses depends upon1. magnetic effect of the current2. chemical effect of the current3. magnitude of the current4. heating effect of the currentSelect the correct answer using the code given below.
questions.solution: Solution:		Working of safety fuses depends upon magnitude of the current andheating effect of the current.

questions.Question: During thunderstorm you are travelling in a car. To protect yourself from the lightning you will have to
questions.optionB: Get out of the car and lie flat in the ground
questions.optionC: Abandon the car and take shelter under a nearby tree
questions.solution: Solution:		During thunderstorm you are travelling in a car. To protect yourself from the lightning you will have to remain in the car.

questions.Question: The unit of electrical power is
questions.solution: Solution:		The unit of electrical power is Watt.

questions.Question: Safety fuse wire used in domestic electrical appliances is made of metal of low
questions.solution: Solution:		For safety, the fuse wire used in the mains for household supply of electricity must be made of metal having low melting point.

questions.Question: When all the forces and torques are balanced in a mechanical body it is said to be in
questions.solution: Solution:		When all the forces and torques are balanced in a mechanical body it is said to be in equilibrium.

questions.Question: Centrifugal force increases with
questions.solution: Solution:		Centrifugal force can be increased by increasing either the speed of rotation or the mass of the body or by decreasing the radius, which is the distance of the body from the centre of the curve.

questions.Question: The minimum number of forces to keep a particle in equilibrium is
questions.solution: Solution:		Two are the minimum number of forces of equal magnitude ina plane that keep a particle in equilibrium.

questions.solution: Solution:		When Milk is churned vigorously the cream from it is separated out due to Centrifugal Force. Churning physically agitates the cream until it ruptures the fragile membranes surrounding the milk fat.

questions.Question: When the milk is churned vigorously the cream from it is separated out due to
questions.solution: Solution:		When Milk is churned vigorously the cream from it is separated out due to Centrifugal Force. Churning physically agitates the cream until it ruptures the fragile membranes surrounding the milk fat.

questions.Question: Fuse wire is made of an alloy of
questions.solution: Solution:		An electrical fuse is a safety device in the circuit that protects electrical systems by breaking the connection when a short circuit is occurring. The fuse wire is made up of Sn (tin) and Pb (lead) alloy because of its high resistance and low melting point.

questions.Question: In the electrical circuit of a house, the fuse acts as
questions.solution: Solution:		In the electrical circuit of a house, the fuse acts as a safety device.

questions.Question: The nature of fuse wire is
questions.optionA: High resistance and low melting point.
questions.optionB: High resistance and high melting point.
questions.optionC: Low resistance and high melting point.
questions.optionD: Low resistance and low melting point.

questions.Question: Which of these is exhibiting kinetic energy?
questions.optionA: An archer with a flexed bow
questions.optionB: A person sitting on a couch while watching TV
questions.solution: Solution:		A space station orbiting Earth is exhibiting kinetic energy.

questions.Question: An object having the capability to do work is said to possess
questions.solution: Solution:		An object having the capability to do work is said to possess Energy.

questions.Question: The energy emitted by the Sun is due to
questions.solution: Solution:		The sun generates energy from a process called nuclear fusion. During nuclear fusion, the high pressure and temperature in the sun's core cause nuclei to separate from their electrons. Hydrogen nuclei fuse to form one helium atom.

questions.Question: Where does hydroelectric energy come from?
questions.solution: Solution:		Hydroelectric power is produced with moving water.

questions.Question: Which colour has the highest energy?
questions.solution: Solution:		When it comes to visible light, the highest frequency color, which is violet, also has the most energy.

questions.Question: Red is used as an emergency or danger signal as
questions.solution: Solution:		Danger signals are red in color because it is scattered the least by air molecules. Since the color red has the highest wavelength of all the colors we can see it scattered the least. So, red light is used as a danger signal as it is able to travel the longest distance through the fog, rain, etc.

questions.Question: Which of these travels in glass with minimum velocity ?
questions.solution: Solution:		As light passes from air into glass, there is reduction of velocity. Due to longer wavelengths, red waves travel fastest and is refracted the least, while violet waves travel the slowest and is refracted the most.

questions.Question: A white and smooth surface is
questions.optionA: Good absorber and good reflector of heat
questions.optionB: Bad absorber and good reflector of heat
questions.optionC: Good absorber and bad reflector of heat
questions.optionD: Bad absorber and bad reflector of heat
questions.solution: Solution:		A white and smooth surface is bad absorber and good reflector of heat.

questions.Question: The atmosphere is heated mainly by
questions.solution: Solution:		It is evident that the atmosphere is primarily heated from below by radiation from the heated Earth surface.

questions.Question: The direction of heat flow between two objects depends on
questions.optionD: Whether they are in solid, liquid or gaseous state
questions.solution: Solution:		The direction of heat flow between two objects depends on their temperatures. Heat always flows from a body at higher temperature to a body at a lower temperature.

questions.Question: Woollen cloth protects the body from cold because
questions.optionA: It is a good conductor of heat
questions.optionB: It is a poor conductor of heat
questions.optionC: External heat rays enter into the body through the woollen cloth
questions.solution: Solution:		Cotton clothes are thin and do not have space in which air can be trapped. Thus, cotton clothes do not prevent heat coming out of our body. Woollen clothes keep us warm during winter because wool is a poor conductor of heat and it has air trapped in between the fibres.

questions.Question: Hot water is poured simultaneously in four metallic tumblers painted outside with different paints. After some time the water will be found to have cooled most in the tumbler painted.
questions.solution: Solution:		Hot water is poured simultaneously in four metallic tumblers painted outside with different paints. After some time the water will be found to have cooled most in the tumbler painted rough black. Black surfaces are good emitters of heat.

questions.Question: Total internal reflection can not take place when light goes from :
questions.solution: Solution:		Total internal reflection will not take place unless the incident light is traveling within the more optically dense medium towards the less optically dense medium. Total internal reflection can not take place when light goes from water to glass.

questions.Question: A rear-view mirror for driving is
questions.solution: Solution:		Type of mirror used in the rear-view mirror must be convex mirrors, because it creates smaller, yet still upright images. Concave mirrors would create an inverted image and the cars you see are not upside down.

questions.Question: The reflector of a search light is a :
questions.solution: Solution:		Concave mirrors are used in search lights and torches so that we have a more focused light beam which will not diverge out and hence help in searching. It is used for different light rays falling on it to a single point.

questions.Question: Optical Fibre technology works on which of these principles of Physics?
questions.solution: Solution:		The optical fibre is a device which works on the principle of total internal reflection by which light signals can be transmitted from one place to another with a negligible loss of energy.

questions.Question: What is the reason for formation of Mirage in desert?
questions.optionD: Both Refraction and Total internal reflection of light
questions.solution: Solution:		Mirage is formed due to both Refraction and Total internal reflection of light. A mirage is a naturally occurring optical phenomenon in which light rays bend to produce a displaced image of distant objects or the sky.

questions.Question: Which phenomenon is responsible for the echo of sound wave?
questions.solution: Solution:		Reflection is responsible for the echo of sound wave.

questions.Question: Loudness of sound depends on
questions.solution: Solution:		The loudness of sound is directly proportional to the amplitude of the wave. The loudness of the sound increases with increase in the amplitude vibration. The unit of loudness is decibel.

questions.Question: Which one of the following animals can hear ultrasonic sound ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Bat can hear ultrasonic sound.

questions.Question: The instrument which uses sound waves to measure the depth of oceans is
questions.solution: Solution:		Sonar is the instrument which uses sound waves to measure the depth of oceans.
