questions.Question: Megahertz is a measurement of
questions.solution: Solution:		Megahertz is a measurement of frequency.

questions.Question:
Rainbow is produced when sunlight fall on drops of rain. Which of the following physical phenomena are responsible for this?

I.Diffusion
II.Refraction
III.Internal reflection
questions.solution: Solution:		Refraction and internal reflection are responsible for this physical phenomena.

questions.Question: Natural radioactivity was discovered by
questions.solution: Solution:		Natural radioactivity was discovered by Henri Becquerel.

questions.Question: Planets are
questions.optionA: luminous heavenly bodies revolving around a star
questions.optionD: luminous heavenly bodies that do not twinkle
questions.solution: Solution:		Planets are non-luminous heavenly bodies.

questions.Question: One nanometer is equal to
questions.solution: Solution:		One nanometer is equal to 10-9 m.

questions.Question: Mica is used in electrical appliances such as electric iron because mica is
questions.optionA: a good conductor of heat but a bad conductor of electricity
questions.optionB: a bad conductor of heat but a good conductor of electricity
questions.optionC: a good conductor of heat as well as electricity
questions.optionD: a bad conductor of heat as well as electricity
questions.solution: Solution:		Mica is used in electrical appliances such as electric iron because mica is a good conductor of heat but a bad conductor of electricity.

questions.Question: The centre of gravity of a sprinter during the race lies
questions.optionC: At the centre of the body
questions.optionD: To the left side of the body
questions.solution: Solution:		Running is a means of terrestrial locomotion allowing humans and other animals to move rapidly on foot. It is simply defined in athletics terms as a gait in which at regular points during the running cycle both feet are off the ground. This is in contrast to walking, where one foot is always in contact with the ground, the legs are kept mostly straight and the center of gravity vaults over the legs in an inverted pendulum fashion. A characteristic feature of a running body from the viewpoint of spring-mass mechanics is that changes in kinetic and potential energy within a stride occur simultaneously, with energy storage accomplished by springy tendons and passive muscle elasticity.

questions.Question: Who enunciated the laws of planetary motion?
questions.solution: Solution:		Johannes Kepler published his first two laws about planetary motion in 1609 , having found them by analyzing the astronomical observations of Tycho Brahe. Kepler's third law was published in 1619.

questions.Question: The tidal waves on sea is mainly due to
questions.optionA: Gravitational Effect of Moon on Earth
questions.optionB: Gravitational Effect of Sun on Earth
questions.optionC: Gravitational Effect of Earth on Moon
questions.solution: Solution:		The tidal waves on sea is mainly due to gravitational effect of Moon on Earth.

questions.Question: The time period of a pendulum when taken to the Moon would:
questions.solution: Solution:		When the pendulum is taken to the moon, the value of 'g' will decrease and hence time period will increase. As the pendulum takes more time to complete one vibration, it will lose time.

questions.Question: "God Particle" is
questions.solution: Solution:		"God Particle" is Higgs Boson.

questions.Question: Who measured the velocity of light first ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Galileo attempted to record the time between lantern signals but was unsuccessful because the distance involved was too small and light simply moved too fast to be measured this way. Around 1676, Danish astronomer Ole Romer became the first person to prove that light travels at a finite speed.

questions.Question: Light houses are places with powerful lights to :
questions.optionA: Guide and resolve traffic jams in crowded metro-cities during nights
questions.optionB: Guide and help large crowds at religious gathering during nights
questions.optionC: Indicate to the incoming warships, the location of a harbour during night
questions.optionD: Guide and warn the ships coming from different directions in the ocean
questions.solution: Solution:		Light houses are places with powerful lights to guide and warn the ships coming from different directions in the ocean.

questions.Question: It is dangerous to observe Solar eclipse with naked eyes because
questions.optionA: Infrared radiations from sun burn our retina
questions.optionB: Ultraviolet radiations from Sun burn our retina
questions.optionC: All radiations from sun initiate chemical reactions in eyes
questions.optionD: Cosmic rays reach eyes more during the eclipse
questions.solution: Solution:		Exposing your eyes to the sun without proper eye protection during a solar eclipse can cause “eclipse blindness” or retinal burns, also known as solar retinopathy. This exposure to the light can cause damage or even destroy cells in the retina (the back of the eye) that transmit what you see to the brain.

questions.Question: Formation of shadows can be explained by
questions.solution: Solution:		Formation of shadows can be explained by rectilinear propagation of light.

questions.Question: The locomotion of insects to the source of light is called :
questions.solution: Solution:		The locomotion of insects to the source of light is called Phototropic.

questions.Question: Absolute Zero is defined as
questions.optionA: The temperature at which all molecular motion ceases
questions.optionD: At which the volume becomes zero
questions.solution: Solution:		Absolute Zero is defined as temperature at which all molecular motion ceases.

questions.Question: At what temperature (in degree Celsius), the numerical values on Celsius and Fahrenheit scales become equal?
questions.solution: Solution:		Celsius and Fahrenheit are the same at – 40 degrees since the scales converge.

questions.Question: At what temperature (in Fahrenheit) pure water freezes?
questions.solution: Solution:		32oF is the temperature at which fresh water freezes is called the freezing point. The freezing point is the temperature at which a liquid turns to a solid.

questions.Question: On the Kelvin scale, the melting point of ice is
questions.solution: Solution:		The melting point of ice on Kelvin scale is 273 K.

questions.Question: The temperature which has the same reading on both Fahrenheit and Celsius scales is
questions.solution: Solution:		The temperature which has the same reading on both Fahrenheit and Celsius scales is –40°.

questions.Question: Light from Sun reaches Earth in approximately
questions.solution: Solution:		Light from Sun reaches Earth in approximately 8 minutes.

questions.Question: Through which light cannot pass?
questions.solution: Solution:		Light cannot pass through book.

questions.Question: The speed of light in air is
questions.solution: Solution:		The speed of light in air is 3 × 108 m/s.

questions.Question: Eclipses occur due to which optical phenomena?
questions.solution: Solution:		Eclipses occur due to rectilinear propagation of light.

questions.Question: When a bottle of scent is kept open in a corner of a room its odour is felt in all parts of the room. This is due to the phenomenon of :
questions.solution: Solution:		When a bottle of perfume is opened in a corner of a room, the scent soon spreads all over the room. This physical procedure is called diffusion, due to which the liquid or gaseous molecules travels from the area of higher density to that of the lower density of that substance.

questions.Question: Large transformers, when used for some time, become very hot and are cooled by circulating oil. The heating of the transformer is due to:
questions.optionA: The heating effect of current alone
questions.optionC: Both the heating effect of current and hysteresis loss
questions.solution: Solution:		Large transformers, when used for some time, become very hot and are cooled by circulating oil. The heating of the transformer is due to both the heating effect of current and hysteresis loss.

questions.Question: Nuclear sizes are expressed in a unit named
questions.solution: Solution:Fermi - A unit of length equal to 10-15 meter (one femtometer), used in nuclear physics. It is similar to the diameter of a proton.

questions.Question: Light year is a unit of
questions.solution: Solution:		Light year is a unit of distance.

questions.Question: Mirage is due to:
questions.optionA: Unequal heating of different parts of the atmosphere
questions.optionC: Depletion of ozone layer in the atmosphere
questions.optionD: Equal heating of different parts of the atmosphere
questions.solution: Solution:		Mirages happen when the ground is very hot and the air is cool. The hot ground warms a layer of air just above the ground. When the light moves through the cold air and into the layer of hot air it is refracted (bent). A layer of very warm air near the ground refracts the light from the sky nearly into a U-shaped bend.

questions.Question: Light from the Sun reaches us in nearly
questions.solution: Solution:		The light from the sun takes about 8 minutes to reach the Earth after it has been emitted from the sun's surface.

questions.Question: Magnetic keepers are used to protect magnets from :
questions.solution: Solution:		Magnetic keepers are soft iron bars placed at either end of the pair of magnets. It is used to avoid self-demagnetisation of magnets.

questions.Question: Which among the following is the fundamental quantity ?
questions.solution: Solution:		In physics, there are seven fundamental physical quantities that are measured in base or physical fundamental units: length, mass, time, electric current, temperature, amount of substance and luminous intensity.

questions.Question: A bucket of water is hung from a spring balance. A piece of iron is suspended in the water without touching the sides or touching the bottom of the bucket. The reading of the spring balance
questions.optionD: Varies with the increase of depth of the immersion of the iron piece
questions.solution: Solution:		When the piece of iron is lowered into the water, the water level in the bucket increases. And so the pressure at the bottom of bucket also increases. Thus the total thrust at the bottom also increases. Therefore the spring balance reading increases.

questions.Question: 1 amu is equivalent to
questions.solution: Solution:		1 amu is equivalent to 931 MeV.

questions.Question: 1 m/s equals ________ km/hr
questions.solution: Solution:		1 m/s equals 18/5 km/hr.

questions.Question: The blue colour of water in the sea is due to
questions.optionA: Absorption of other colours except blue by water molecules
questions.optionB: Scattering of blue light by water molecules
questions.optionC: Reflection of blue light by impurities in sea water
questions.optionD: Reflection of blue sky by sea water
questions.solution: Solution:		The ocean is blue because water absorbs colours in the red part of the light spectrum. Like a filter, this leaves behind colours in the blue part of the light spectrum for us to see. The ocean may also take on green, red, or other hues as light bounces off of floating sediments and particles in the water.

questions.Question: The bending of light when it passes around a corner or a slit is due to ________
questions.solution: Solution:		Diffraction is the slight bending of light as it passes around the edge of an object. The amount of bending depends on the relative size of the wavelength of light to the size of the opening.

questions.Question: The colour of the ocean appears to be blue because the sunlight falling on it is
questions.solution: Solution:		The reason the ocean is blue is due to the absorption and scattering of light. The blue wavelengths of light are scattered, similar to the scattering of blue light in the sky but absorption is a much larger factor than scattering for the clear ocean water.

questions.Question: Which of the following statements is true when we see ''rainbow' ?
questions.optionB: The Sun remains behind us and we face raindrops
questions.optionC: In light rainfall, we face Sun
questions.optionD: The sky remains clear and the sun is at lower position in the sky
questions.solution: Solution:		We see rainbows because of the geometry of raindrops. When the sun shines from behind us into the rain, incident rays of light enter the drop and are refracted inwards. They are reflected from the back surface of the raindrop, and refracted again as they exit the raindrop and return to our eyes. A rainbow is an optical and meteorological phenomenon that is caused by reflection of light in water droplets in the Earth’s atmosphere, resulting in a spectrum of light appearing in the sky.

questions.Question: Danger signals are generally red as red light
questions.solution: Solution:		The primary reason why the colour red is used for danger signals is that red light is scattered the least by air molecules. The effect of scattering is inversely related to the fourth power of the wavelength of a colour. Therefore blue which has the least wavelength of all the visible radiations is scattered the most and red which has the highest wavelength of all the colours we can see is scattered the least. So red light is able to travel the longest distance through fog, rain, and the alike. Also, red is a colour we inherently perceive as one that is associated with danger.

questions.Question: A person does some work of 1,000 J in 2 s. His power will be ________
questions.solution: Solution:		Power = work / time = 1000 / 2 = 500 W

questions.Question: Which results in an increase in power?
questions.optionA: Doing more work in less time.
questions.optionB: Doing less work in more time.
questions.optionC: Doing less work in less time.
questions.optionD: Doing more work in more time.
questions.solution: Solution:		By doing more work in less time we can increase the power. And, Power is inversely proportional to time taken to do a work. So, when we do more work in lesser time , power will also increase.

questions.Question: What device converts light energy to electrical energy?
questions.solution: Solution:		Photovoltaic cell converts light energy to electrical energy.

questions.Question: In a water lifting electric pump, we convert
questions.solution: Solution:		In a water lifting electric pump, we convert electrical energy into potential energy.

questions.Question: The device which converts sound energy into electrical energy is called
questions.solution: Solution:		The device which converts sound energy into electrical energy is called microphone.

questions.Question: Friction can be reduced by changing from
questions.solution: Solution:		Friction can be reduced by changing from sliding to rolling. Replace sliding friction with rolling element friction, such as with the use of rolling element bearings.

questions.Question: It is more difficult to walk on ice than on a concrete road because
questions.optionA: There is very little friction between the ice and feet pressing it
questions.optionB: Ice is soft when compared to concrete
questions.optionC: There is more friction between the ice and feer
questions.solution: Solution:		Main thing is that we find more friction on roads than on ice. As, we can call the friction as grip on roads. We can hear the word by tyre companies as the road grip tyres. Here the grip of the tyre is more than that of any normal tyre.

questions.Question: A ball rolling along the ground gradually slows down and finally comes to rest is due to ________
questions.solution: Solution:		A ball rolling along the ground gradually slows down and finally comes to rest. It is the force of friction between the surface of the ball and the ground that brings the moving ball to rest.

questions.Question: Frictional force acts in
questions.optionA: The same direction as the motion
questions.optionB: The opposite direction of the motion
questions.solution: Solution:		The part which is tangent to the contacting surfaces is called the frictional force. Friction is a resisting force that acts on a body to prevent or retard its motion. Friction force always acts tangent to the surface at points of contact. Friction force acts opposite to the direction of motion.

questions.Question: The force which makes a vehicle to stop when break is applied is called
questions.solution: Solution:		A brake is a mechanical device that inhibits motion by absorbing energy from a moving system. It is used for slowing or stopping a moving vehicle, wheel, axle, or to prevent its motion, most often accomplished by means of friction.

questions.Question: Which one of the following has the highest value of specific heat?
questions.solution: Solution:		Among all the four water has the highest specific heat.

questions.Question: Water is not suitable as a calorimetric substance because it :
questions.solution: Solution:		The specific heat of water is higher than all other common substances. Hence, water is used for heating purposes (as in hot water bottles) and for cooling purposes (as in radiators of cars). Off all the liquids, mercury has the lowest specific heat due to which it is used as a thermometric liquid .

questions.Question: Water is used in car radiator because of its
questions.solution: Solution:		Water is used as a coolant in automobiles radiators because it has high specific heat capacity. So, it absorbs a large amount of heat for a degree rise in temperature.

questions.Question: How much mechanical work must be done to completely melt 1 gram of ice at 0°C ?
questions.solution: Solution:		It takes 80 calories to melt 1 gram of ice. If 1 g of ice (at 0 degrees Celsius) is given 80 calories, it will melt and the final temperature of the water will be 0. Freezing water at 0 degrees Celsius: It also takes 80 calories to freeze 1 gram of water.

questions.Question: Water pipes in hilly areas often burst on a cold frosty night, because
questions.optionA: The material of which pipes are made contracts due to cold and so breaks
questions.optionB: Water in the pipes freezes and on freezing water expands, so pipes break
questions.optionC: Frost makes the pipes rusty, so they break
questions.solution: Solution:		Water pipes burst because the water inside them expands is it gets close to freezing, and this causes an increase in pressure inside the pipe.

questions.Question: Electromagnet is constructed with which of the following ?
questions.solution: Solution:		An electromagnet is a type of magnet in which the magnetic field is produced by an electric current. The magnetic field disappears when the current is turned off. It is made of soft iron since it has the property of losing its magnetism very quickly. The soft iron core of the electromagnet makes the magnetic field stronger.

questions.Question: When number of turns in a coil is trippled, without any change in the length of coil, its self inductance becomes?
questions.solution: Solution:		L = inductance is proportional to the number of turns per unit length. So self inductance becomes three times. if turns in a coil is trippled, self inductance become nine times.

questions.Question: Fleming's right hand rule is used to find the direction of the
questions.solution: Solution:		Fleming's right-hand rule (for generators) shows the direction of induced current when a conductor attached to a circuit moves in a magnetic field. It can be used to determine the direction of current in a generator's windings.

questions.Question: A current carrying conductor is associated with
questions.solution: Solution:		A current carrying conductor, such as a metal wire, will produce a magnetic field around it because of the motion of charge within the wire itself. This motion produces or sets up a magnetic field around the wire in the form of concentric circles. This electromagnetic effect is described in physics by the Biot-Savart Law, an experimentally deduced inverse-square law. The effect is also described by Ampere’s Law, which is derived from the Biot-Savart Law.

questions.Question: In order to make an electromagnet you need a
questions.solution: Solution:		In order to make an electromagnet you need a dry cell batteries, thin coated copper wire and iron nail.

questions.Question: Rainbows are produced when sunlight :
questions.optionA: Incident on rain drops hanging in the atmosphere is dispersed after suffering refraction
questions.optionB: Incident on rain drops hanging in the atmosphere is dispersed after suffering refraction and internal reflection.
questions.optionC: Incident on raindrops hanging in the atmosphere is dispresed after suffering reflection.
questions.optionD: None of the given statements is correct.
questions.solution: Solution:		Rainbows are produced when sunlight incident on rain drops hanging in the atmosphere is dispersed after suffering refraction and internal reflection.

questions.Question: Red light is used for signals because it has
questions.solution: Solution:		Red light is used as danger signal because it is having high wavelength, less scattering ,hence can travel larger distances.

questions.Question: Why does the sea appear blue in colour?
questions.optionA: Reflection of the sun light from water surface
questions.optionB: Interference of the sun light from water surface
questions.optionC: Scattering of the sunlight by water molecules
questions.solution: Solution:		When sunlight hits the surface of sea or ocean, some of the light gets reflected back,whereas, most of the longer wavelengths such as red, orange and yellow penetrate sea water and get absorbed by the water molecules. So only the shorter wavelengths of light which contain violet and blue colors are reflected back to reach our eyes. Hence the sea water appears blue.

questions.Question: The sky appears blue because
questions.optionA: All colours interfere to produce blue
questions.optionB: In white light, the blue component dominates
questions.optionC: The atmosphere scatters blue colour more than the others
questions.solution: Solution:		Gases and particles in Earth's atmosphere scatter sunlight in all directions. Blue light is scattered more than other colors because it travels as shorter, smaller waves. This is why we see a blue sky most of the time.

questions.Question: During washing of clothes, we use indigo due to its
questions.solution: Solution:		Indigo is a dye different than any other. It does not require any mordant. Rather it is dyed through a living fermentation process. The process “reduces” the Indigo, changing it from blue to yellow. In this state, it dissolves in an alkaline solution. The fibre is worked in the solution, or “vat”. When brought out to the air, it is a bright green. Slowly the air changes it to the beautiful deep and rich blue of Indigo.

questions.Question: Two rods, one of copper and other of steel, experience the same upthrust when placed in water.Thus, both have
questions.solution: Solution:		When a body is placed in water, the upthrust or buoyant force acting on it depends upon the following factors: (i) Volume of the body submerged in the liquid - (V), or volume of the liquid displaced - (V); (ii) Density of the liquid - (d); and (iii) Acceleration due to gravity In-line. Since in the present question, we can assume g to be a constant and know that steel and copper have different densities, the only case in which they can have similar upthrust will be because of their volumes.

questions.Question: If ice floating on water in a vessel melts, the water level in the vessel ________ .
questions.solution: Solution:		If ice floating on water in a vessel melts, the water level in the vessel does not change.

questions.Question: On a clean glass plate a drop of water spreads to form a thin layer whereas a drop of mercury remains almost spherical because
questions.optionB: Density of mercury is greater than that of water
questions.optionC: Cohesion of mercury is greater than its adhesion with glass
questions.optionD: Cohesion of water is greater than its adhesion with glass
questions.solution: Solution:		On a clean glass plate a drop of water spreads to form a thin layer whereas a drop of mercury remains almost spherical because cohesion of mercury is greater than its adhesion with glass.

questions.Question: The velocity of falling rain drops attains a terminal value because of
questions.solution: Solution:		The velocity of falling rain drops attains a terminal value because of viscous force exerted by air.

questions.Question: Which one is the unit of surface tension of a liquid
questions.solution: Solution:		The unit of surface tension of a liquid is Electron volt /cm2.

questions.Question: On a cold day when a room temperature is 15oC, the metallic cap of a pen becomes much colder than its plastic body, though both are at the same temperature of 15oC, because
questions.optionA: metals have higher thermal capacity than plastics
questions.optionB: plastics have a lower density than metals
questions.optionC: metals are good conductor of heat
questions.optionD: plastics have a higher thermal conductivity than metals
questions.solution: Solution:Metals are good conductor of heat.

questions.Question: Sound produced at a point is heard by a person after 5 second, while the same sound is heard by another person after 6 seconds. If the speed of sound is 300 m/s, what could be the maximum and minimum distances between the two persons?
questions.solution: Solution:3.3 km, 0.30 km.

questions.Question: Intensity of sound at a point is ____ its distance from the source.
questions.solution: Solution:Intensity of sound at a point is inversely proportional to square of its distance from the source.

questions.Question: Of the four locations mentioned below the highest inside temperature will be attained in the pressure cooker operated with the pressure valve open
questions.optionB: at the top of Mt. Everest
questions.optionC: at a place in a valley below sea level
questions.optionD: in an aeroplane flying at a height of 10,000 m with inside pressure maintained at the sea level
questions.solution: Solution:		Of the four locations mentioned below the highest inside temperature will be attained in the pressure cooker operated with the pressure valve open at a place in a valley below sea level.

questions.Question: Radio telescopes are better than optical telescopes because
questions.optionA: they can detect faint galaxies which no optical telescope can
questions.optionB: they can work even in cloudy conditions
questions.optionC: they can work during the day and night
questions.solution: Solution:		Radio telescopes are better than optical telescopes because they can detect faint galaxies which no optical telescope can, they can work even in cloudy conditions and they can work during the day and night.

questions.Question: Gravitational force is maximum at which place
questions.solution: Solution:		Gravitational force is maximum at Poles. The gravitational force is almost equal in every where in the earth. The resultant force is maximum in pole.

questions.Question: A metal ball and a rubber ball, both having the same mass, strike a wall normally with the same velocity. The rubber ball rebounds and the metal ball does not rebound. It can be concluded that
questions.optionA: The rubber ball suffers greater change in momentum
questions.optionB: The metal ball suffers greater change in momentum
questions.optionC: Both suffer the same change in momentum
questions.optionD: The initial momentum of the rubber ball is greater than that of the metal ball
questions.solution: Solution:		As per the question, the rubber ball rebounds while the metal ball does not. So if m and v be the mass and velocity respectively, the change in momentum of rubber ball = 2 mv (in magnitude). However, the change in momentum of the metal ball = mv. The rubber ball suffers almost twice the change in momentum as experienced by the metal ball.

questions.Question: A boy sitting in an open car moving with the constant speed throws a ball straight up into the air. The ball falls
questions.solution: Solution:		The moment ball is thrown, it is moving with the velocity of the car. According to the inertia of motion it will continue to move in the same direction with the same velocity. As the ball is moving up and the down it will maintain its forward motion but practically it is not possible to neglect the resistance caused by air friction. So, the ball will fall behind him. Inertia is the resistance of any physical object to a change in its state of motion or rest, or the tendency of an object to resist any change in its motion.

questions.Question: Rate of change of momentum is
questions.solution: Solution:		The rate of change of linear momentum of a body is directly proportional to the external force applied on the body , and takes place always in the direction of the force applied.

questions.Question: Which law is also called law of inertia ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Newton first law is called law of inertia.

questions.Question: Heat from the Sun reaches the Earth by
questions.solution: Solution:		Radiation is the transfer of heat energy through space by electromagnetic radiation. Most of the electromagnetic radiation that comes to the earth from the sun is invisible.

questions.Question: Heat transfer by conduction occurs when molecules
questions.solution: Solution:		Conduction is the transfer of heat between substances that are in direct contact with each other. Conduction occurs when a substance is heated, particles will gain more energy, and vibrate more. These molecules then bump into nearby particles and transfer some of their energy to them.

questions.Question: A body absorbs heat most if it is
questions.solution: Solution:		A body absorbs heat most if it is black and rough.

questions.Question: A black body can absorb radiations of :
questions.solution: Solution:		A black body can absorb radiations of all wavelengths.

questions.Question: The cover of a solar cooker is made of glass because
questions.optionC: It retains the heat inside by the green house effect
questions.optionD: It rediates heat better than metals
questions.solution: Solution:		Cover of the solar cooker is made of glass because glass allows the sunlight to pass through it and concentrate at one focal point, it also prevents heat to escape out of the cooker.

questions.Question: At what temperature do the Fahrenheit and Celsius scales give the same reading?
questions.solution: Solution:		The temperature when both the Celsius and Fahrenheit scales are the same is -40 degrees.

questions.Question: The temperature of a liquid is 32° F. What is its temperature in Celsius scale?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Fahrenheit scale defines the freezing point of water as 32°F and the boiling point as 212°F. The Celsius scale sets the freezing point and boiling point of water at 0°C and 100°C respectively.

questions.Question: To convert temperature from Celcius to Kelvin scale, you must ________ the given temperature.
questions.solution: Solution:		Take your Celsius temperature and add 273. Your answer will be in Kelvin.

questions.Question: 0°K is equivalent to
questions.solution: Solution:		0°K is equivalent to – 273°C.

questions.Question: In very cold countries alcohol is used as a thermometric liquid because
questions.optionA: Alcohol is a poor conductor of heat
questions.optionB: Alcohol can be coloured for its level to be seen easily
questions.optionC: Its freezing point is very low
questions.optionD: It will not stick to the glass tube
questions.solution: Solution:		Alcohol has a freezing point as low as -117oC. So it won't freeze even in very cold countries.

questions.Question: The size of gear is usually specified by
questions.solution: Solution:		The size of the gear is usually specified by the pitch circle diameter. It is also called as pitch diameter.

questions.Question: Which of the following is a compound machine?
questions.solution: Solution:		Bicycle is an example of compound machine. A compound machine is a combination of two or more simple machines.

questions.Question: Which of the following is an example for cantilever beam?
questions.solution: Solution:		A cantilever is a beam anchored at only one end. The beam carries the load to the support where it is resisted by moment and shear stress. Cantilever construction allows for overhanging structures without external bracing. Cantilevers can also be constructed with trusses or slabs. This is in contrast to a simply supported beam such as those found in a post and lintel system. A simply supported beam is supported at both ends with loads applied between the supports. Cantilevers are widely found in construction, notably in cantilever bridges.

questions.Question: A machine powered by rotating blades is a
questions.solution: Solution:		A machine powered by rotating blades is a turbines. A turbine is a device that harnesses the kinetic energy of some fluid - such as water, steam, air, or combustion gases - and turns this into the rotational motion of the device itself.[2] These devices are generally used in electrical generation, engines, and propulsion systems and are classified as a type of engine.

questions.Question: Second and third class levers are differentiated by
questions.solution: Solution:		Second and third class levers are differentiated by the location of the load.

questions.Question: The motion of a freely falling body is an example of ________ accelerated motion.
questions.solution: Solution:		The motion of a freely falling body is an example of uniformly accelerated motion.

questions.Question: A body is initially moving with a velocity of 5 m/s. It undergoes an acceleration of 2 m/s2 for 4 seconds. Find the displacement (in m) of this body in these 4 seconds.
questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: Formula for distance is
questions.solution: Solution:		Formula for distance is speed x time.

questions.Question: Which among the following is false about displacement?
questions.optionA: It can be positive, negative or zero
questions.optionB: Displacement is never greater than Distance
questions.solution: Solution:		Displacement can be either positive or negative.

questions.Question: The motion of the wheels of a bullock-cart while moving on the road is an example of
questions.solution: Solution:		Rotatory motion is turning round in a circle, such as a wheel turning. While the wheel is moving, the mechanism transfers translatory motion into rotatory motion. As a matter of fact, translatory motion and rotatory motion occur at the same time.

questions.Question: Conservation of energy refers to the fact that
questions.optionA: If you conserve energy you will not be as tired
questions.optionB: Energy cannot be created or destroyed but can be converted from one form to another
questions.optionC: No chemical reaction is 100 percent efficient
questions.optionD: The entropy of the universe is always increasing
questions.solution: Solution:		"Conservation of energy" refers to the fact that energy cannot be created or destroyed but can be converted from one form to another.

questions.Question: Which of the following causes adiabatic temperature changes in atmosphere?
questions.optionC: Expansion and compression of the air
questions.optionD: Partial absorption of solar radiation by the atmosphere
questions.solution: Solution:		Application of temperature changes in the atmosphere is in adiabatics, or temperature change which are caused by compressing or allowing air to expand.

questions.Question: Which of the following options correctly explains the term heat budget?
questions.optionA: It is a mode of transfer of heat through matter by molecular activity.
questions.optionB: It is the balance between incoming and outgoing radiation
questions.optionC: It is the radiation from the earth in the form of long waves.
questions.optionD: It is the amount of heat which the surface of earth receives from the sun.
questions.solution: Solution:		Incoming heat being absorbed by the Earth, and outgoing heat escaping the Earth in the form of radiation are both perfectly balanced. If they were not balanced, then Earth would be getting either progressively warmer or progressively cooler with each passing year. This balance between incoming and outgoing heat is known as Earth’s heat budget.

questions.Question: Which one of the following is not a feature of Indifference Curve?
questions.optionA: They do not intersect each other
questions.optionB: They slope downwards to the right
questions.optionC: They are parallel to each other
questions.optionD: They are concave to each other
questions.solution: Solution:		Indifference curves are usually convex to the origin. In other words, the indifference curve is relatively flatter in its right-hand portion and relatively steeper in its left-hand portion. The degree of convexity of an indifference curve depends on the rate of fall in the marginal rate of substitution.

questions.Question: Instruments for measuring Solar Radiation?
questions.solution: Solution:		Instruments for measuring Solar Radiation is Pyranometer.

questions.Question: Sound following a flash of lightning is called
questions.solution: Solution:		Sound following a flash of lightning is called Thunder. Thunder or thunder clap always follows lightning because light travels faster than sound. Thunder is caused by the rush of air into the space, created by lightning as it travels from cloud to earth.

questions.Question: Acceptable noise level for human ear
questions.solution: Solution:		Because people can't hear all frequencies, or pitches of sound, A-weighted decibels (dBA) can be used to describe sound based on what human ears can actually hear. Sounds at or below 70 dBA are generally considered safe. Any sound at or above 85 dBA is more likely to damage your hearing over time.

questions.Question: Decibel is a term connected with :
questions.solution: Solution:		Decibel is a term connected with sound.

questions.Question: Decibel is the unit used for
questions.solution: Solution:		Decibel is the unit used for intensity of sound.

questions.Question: The speed of sound in air depends on
questions.solution: Solution:		The speed of sound in air depends on the type of gas and the temperature of the gas. On Earth, the atmosphere is composed of mostly diatomic nitrogen and oxygen, and the temperature depends on the altitude in a rather complex way.

questions.Question: Work done in a free expansion process is
questions.solution: Solution:		In free expansion there is no work done as there is no external external pressure. That's certainly true, in fact free expansion is an irreversible process in which a gas expands into an insulated evacuated chamber, you can think of it like ann container with a piston and the gas is left to expand in vacuum.

questions.Question: An object of 10 kg is moving with a speed of 2 m/s. The kinetic energy of the object is
questions.solution: Solution:		Kinetic energy = 1/2mv2 = 1/2*10*22 = 1/2*10*4 = 5*4 = 20 J

questions.Question: If both the mass and the velocity of a body is increased to twice of their magnitude, the kinetic energy will increase by
questions.solution: Solution:		If you double mass and double velocity, you get eight times the kinetic energy, no matter what your first energy is. As an object's kinetic energy increases, and momentum is mass x velocity.

questions.Question: Kinetic energy depends on
questions.optionA: The velocity or speed of the moving body.
questions.optionB: The mass of the moving body
questions.optionC: The pressure of the moving body
questions.optionD: Both mass and velocity of the moving body
questions.solution: Solution:		Kinetic energy depends on both mass and velocity of the moving body.

questions.Question: The device used to convert solar energy into electricity is
questions.solution: Solution:		A photovoltaic cell, commonly called a solar cell or PV, is the technology used to convert solar energy directly into electrical power. A photovoltaic cell is a non-mechanical device usually made from silicon alloys. Sunlight is composed of photons, or particles of solar energy.

questions.Question: What is the SI unit of intensity of sound?
questions.solution: Solution:		Decibelis the SI unit of intensity of sound.

questions.Question: Sound cannot pass through
questions.solution: Solution:		Sound cannot travel through a perfect vacuum. A vacuum is an area without any air, like space. So sound cannot travel through space because there is no matter for the vibration to work in.

questions.Question: Sound waves cannot travel in
questions.solution: Solution:		Sound cannot travel through a perfect vacuum. A vacuum is an area without any air, like space. So sound cannot travel through space because there is no matter for the vibration to work in.

questions.Question: The quality or tone of a musical sound produced by a stringed instrument depends on
questions.optionB: Length of the strings in the instrument
questions.solution: Solution:		The timbre or quality of a sound depends on its wave form, which varies with the number of overtones, or harmonics, that are present, their frequencies, and their relative intensities. In simple terms, timbre is what makes a particular musical sound have a different sound from another, even when they have the same pitch and loudness.

questions.Question: Which determines the frequency of a sound wave?
questions.solution: Solution:		Amplitude determines the frequency of a sound wave.

questions.Question: The unit of energy in MKS system is
questions.solution: Solution:		1 Joule (J) is the MKS unit of energy, equal to the force of one Newton acting through one meter. 1 Watt is the power from a current of 1 Ampere flowing through 1 Volt.

questions.Question: One light year is equal to
questions.solution: Solution:		One light year is equal to 5.88 trillion miles (6 trillion miles approx).

questions.Question: Parsec is the unit of
questions.solution: Solution:		One parsec is the distance to an object whose parallax angle is one arc second. The radius of the Earth's orbit equals one astronomical unit (AU), so an object that is one parsec distant is 206,265 AU (or 3.26 light-years) away.

questions.Question: One nanometer is equal to ________ meters.
questions.solution: Solution:		One nanometer is equal to 10 raised to the power (-9) meters.

questions.Question: The Length of the Day is determined in
questions.solution: Solution:		The length of the day is determined in astronomical units.

questions.Question: Noise is measured in
questions.solution: Solution:		We measure sound intensity (also referred to as sound power or sound pressure) in units called decibels.

questions.Question: Man perceives sound vibrations in the frequency ranges of
questions.solution: Solution:		Human ear perceives frequencies between 20 Hz (lowest pitch) to 20 kHz (highest pitch).

questions.Question: Instrument used to study the behaviour of a vibrating string is :
questions.solution: Solution:		A Sonometer is a device for demonstrating the relationship between the frequency of the sound produced by a plucked string, and the tension, length and mass per unit length of the string.

questions.Question: Among the following materials sound travels fastest in
questions.solution: Solution:		Among the following materials sound travels fastest in steel.

questions.Question: Sound becomes hazardous noise pollution at decibels?
questions.solution: Solution:		Sound levels are measured in decibels(dB), sound level of 80 or more dB can aptly be called noise which can cause serious hearing loss, tensions, high blood pressure, it can induce several disorders prematurely existing, such as hypertension, an increase in blood cholesterol leveland is detrimental to health in other aspects when observed for more than maximum tolerable limit of 50 dB. Hence, the correct answer is 'Above 80 dB'.

questions.Question: A body falling through a liquid acquires a steady velocity is known as
questions.solution: Solution:		When an object falls through a fluid, it attains a constant velocity through its subsequent motion. This happens because the net force on the body due to gravity and fluid becomes zero. This constant velocity is termed as terminal velocity.

questions.Question: The spoon dropped by an astronaut in a satellite will
questions.optionC: Continue to follow the motion of the satellite
questions.solution: Solution:		An orbiting satellite is a projectile in the sense that the only force acting upon an orbiting satellite is the force of gravity. A satellite is acted upon by the force of gravity and this force does accelerate it towards the Earth. In the absence of gravity a satellite would move in a straight line path tangent to the Earth. In the absence of any forces whatsoever, an object in motion (such as a satellite) would continue in motion with the same speed and in the same direction. The force of gravity acts upon a high speed satellite to deviate its trajectory from a straight-line inertial path. Indeed, a satellite is accelerating towards the Earth due to the force of gravity. As far as spoon dropped by astronaut in a satellite is concerned, it continues to follow the motion of the satellite as there is inertia of motion acting upon it.

questions.Question: An aircraft can perform aerobatic manoeuvres in a vertical loop because of
questions.solution: Solution:		It happens because of gravity. A key feature of super maneuvering aircrafts is a high thrust-to-weight ratio; that is, the comparison of the force produced by the engines to the aircraft’s weight, which is the force of gravity on the aircraft. A thrust-to-weight ratio greater than 1:1 is a critical threshold, as it allows the aircraft to maintain and even gain velocity in a nose-up attitude; such a climb is based on sheer engine power, without any lift provided by the wings to counter gravity, and has become crucial to aerobatic maneuvers in the vertical loop.

questions.Question: Which one is not a part of Kepler's Law?
questions.solution: Solution:		Law of speed is not a part of Kepler's Law.

questions.Question: Kepler's law of planetary motion states that the square of the time period is proportional to the
questions.optionD: Fourth power of the semi-major axis
questions.solution: Solution:		The square of the time period of the planet is directly proportional to the cube of the semimajor axis of its orbit.

questions.Question: In total internal reflection, the light travel from
questions.optionA: Rarer to denser medium and it occurs with no loss of intensity
questions.optionB: Denser to rarer medium and it occurs with no loss of intensity
questions.optionC: Rarer to denser medium and it occurs with loss of intensity
questions.optionD: Denser to rarer medium and it occurs with loss of intensity
questions.solution: Solution:		For total internal reflection to occur the light must travel from a dense medium to a less dense medium (e.g. glass to air or water to air). As the angle of incidence increases so does the angle of refraction.

questions.Question: Convex mirrors are used as a rear view mirror in motor cycles because
questions.optionC: It forms smaller image as compared with object
questions.solution: Solution:		We use convex mirror as a rear view mirror in the vehicles because convex mirror always forms virtual, erect and diminished images irrespective of distance of the object. A convex mirror enables a driver to view large area of the traffic behind him. Convex mirror forms very small image than the object.We use convex mirror as a rear view mirror in the vehicles because convex mirror always forms virtual, erect and diminished images irrespective of distance of the object. A convex mirror enables a driver to view large area of the traffic behind him. Convex mirror forms very small image than the object.

questions.Question: A convex mirror of focal length f (in air) is immersed in a liquid (u=4/3). The focal length of the mirror in the liquid will be :
questions.solution: Solution:		Mirrors, spherical or otherwise are based on the laws of reflection. That behavior is not affected by the medium in which the light travels, so the mirror's focal length would be no different in air or any other medium.

questions.Question: The phenomenon which causes mirage is
questions.solution: Solution:		Mirage is a phenomenon due to total internal reflection of light. It happens when the light goes from optically denser medium (cool air) to rarer medium (hot air) and angle of incidence is equal to or greater than the critical angle resulting total internal reflection at the interface of the two mediums.

questions.Question: Rear view mirror of car is convex or concave?
questions.solution: Solution:		Rear view mirror of car is convex.

questions.Question: The snow on the mountains does not melt all at once when it is heated by the sun because:
questions.optionB: It reflects most of the heat from the sun
questions.optionC: It has a low specific heat capacity
questions.optionD: It has a high latent heat of fusion
questions.solution: Solution:		Newly formed snow reflects about 90 per cent of the sunlight that falls upon it. This means that the sun is powerless to melt clean snow. And when snow does melt, it is not because of the sunlight. It melts because of the warm air from the sea.

questions.Question: Cloudy nights are warmer compared to clear cloudless nights, because clouds mainly
questions.optionA: Absorb heat from the atmosphere send it towards earth
questions.optionB: Prevent cold waves from the sky descending on earth
questions.optionC: Reflect back the heat given by earth
questions.optionD: Produce heat and radiate it toward earth
questions.solution: Solution:		It is because the night side of Earth will radiate infra-red radiation (heat) back into space. When there is cloud cover, the clouds act like a blanket and trap the heat close to the ground just like a blanket traps heat close to our body.

questions.Question: In which one of the following the phenomenon of total internal reflection of light is used ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Formation of mirage is the phenomenon of total internal reflection of light.

questions.Question: Which type of mirror is used in the head lights of vehicles ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Concave mirrors are used in head lights of vehicles because when the bulb of headlight is placed at focus of concave mirror it will allow the light to spread out to infinity after the reflection on the mirror.

questions.Question: If objects appear enlarged and inverted in a rear view mirror, then which type of mirror is used?
questions.solution: Solution:		If objects appear enlarged and inverted in a rear view mirror, then concave mirror is used.

questions.Question: A piece of wood is held under water. The upthrust on it will be:
questions.optionA: Equal to the weight of the wood
questions.optionB: Less than weight of the wood
questions.optionC: More than weight of the wood
questions.solution: Solution:		Since wooden piece is to float on water, upthrust acting on it under water is greater than the weight of the wooden piece.

questions.Question: An egg sinks in soft water but floats in a concentrated solution of salt because
questions.optionA: Egg absorbs salt from the solution and expands
questions.optionB: Albumin dissolves in salt solution and egg becomes lighter
questions.optionC: The density of salt solution exceeds the density of eggs
questions.solution: Solution:		Following the density principle, the density of the egg compared to the density of the tap water is lesser (the density principle states that an object or substance with lesser density will float on the surface of the substance or object which has the greater density). Now, with salt, salt makes the density of the tap water to increase and increases also the salinity of the water making the egg float because the density of the water with salt is now greater than the density of the egg and that is why an egg sinks in soft water but floats in a concentrated solution of salt.

questions.Question: When a ship enters the sea from a river what will be the effect?
questions.solution: Solution:		When a ship enters a sea from a river, the ship is elevated or uplifted due to the density of sea water and during the buoyant motion of the ship, as it would gain both potential and kinetic energy when rising in the fluid.

questions.Question: Two identical solid pieces, one of gold and other of silver, when immersed completely in water exhibit equal weights. When weighed in air (given that density of gold is greater than that of silver)
questions.optionA: The gold piece will weigh more
questions.optionB: The silver piece will weigh more
questions.optionC: Both silver and gold pieces weigh equal
questions.optionD: Weighing will depend on their masses
questions.solution: Solution:		As it is said that density of gold is greater than that of density of silver, so silver occupies a greater volume than gold. So it has more upthrust from the water, although they both show the same weight under water, there is more silver present. Hence silver piece will weigh more.

questions.Question: When a body is immersed in a liquid, the force acting on it is
questions.solution: Solution:		According to the Principle of Flotation, when a body is immersed in a fluid, two forces act on it: (1) The weight of the body acting vertically downward through the centre of gravity of the body, and (2) The upthrust of the fluid acting vertically upward through the centre of gravity of the fluid displaced, i.e., centre of buoyancy. The upthrust is also termed as buoyant force.

questions.Question: In which form is the supplied heat energy stored during change in temperature of substance?
questions.solution: Solution:		Kinetic energy is the supplied heat energy stored during change in temperature of substance.

questions.Question: What is another name for energy of motion?
questions.solution: Solution:		Kinetic energy is the energy of motion.

questions.Question: The rate at which energy is transferred is called
questions.solution: Solution:		The rate at which energy is transferred is called power and the amount of energy that is usefully transferred is called efficiency.

questions.Question: An object with a mass of 22 kg moving with a velocity of 5 m/s possesses a kinetic energy of :
questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: In which of the following processes is energy released ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Energy is released during respiration.

questions.Question: Which planet has the lowest density?
questions.solution: Solution:		Saturn is mainly composed of the lightest two gases known, hydrogen and helium. It is the only planet in our solar system whose density is less than water.

questions.Question: The sensation of weightlessness in a spacecraft in an orbit is due to the
questions.optionB: Acceleration in the orbit which is equal to the acceleration due to gravity outside
questions.optionC: Presence of gravity outside but not inside the spacecraft
questions.optionD: Fact that spacecraft in the orbit has no energy
questions.solution: Solution:		The sensation of weightlessness in a spacecraft in an orbit is due to the acceleration in the orbit which is equal to the acceleration due to gravity outside.

questions.Question: The different colours of different stars are due to the variation of
questions.solution: Solution:		The colour of a star – which varies from bluish-white and yellow to orange and red – is primarily due to its composition and effective temperature. And at all times, stars emit light which is a combination of several different wavelengths. On top of that, the colour of a star can change over time.

questions.Question: Which of the following is correct about the properties of Gravitational Forces?
questions.optionA: They are the strongest forces in nature
questions.solution: Solution:		It is a universal attractive force. It is directly proportional to the product of the masses of the two bodies. It obeys inverse square law. It is a long range force and does not need any intervening medium for its operation.

questions.Question: In the absence of the earth's atmosphere, sky would appear
questions.solution: Solution:		Without an atmosphere the sky appears black, as evidenced by the lunar sky in pictures taken from the moon. But even a black sky has some lightness. At night, the sky always has a faint color, called "skyglow" by astronomers.

questions.Question: Lightning heats the surrounding air to
questions.solution: Solution:		Lightning heats the surrounding air to 30000 deg Cent.

questions.Question: Which of the following is not an intrusive igneous body?
questions.solution: Solution:		Batholith is the biggest of the intrusive igneous rocks. Stope is not an intrusive igneous body. It is related to mining.

questions.Question: The instrument for measuring intensity of earthquakes is called
questions.solution: Solution:		The instrument for measuring intensity of earthquakes is called Seismograph.

questions.Question: An instrument that records earthquakes is
questions.solution: Solution:		An instrument that records earthquakes is Seismograph.

questions.Question: To prevent damage from lightning, lightning conductors are used on tall structures. The lightning conductor
questions.optionA: Should be made of a good conductor but can be of any shape
questions.optionB: Should be in the form of a vertical rod
questions.optionD: Should be made of a good conductor like copper with sharp-pointed edges
questions.solution: Solution:		To prevent damage from lightning, lightning conductors are used on tall structures. The lightning conductor should be made of a good conductor like copper with sharp-pointed edges.

questions.Question: The velocity of sound is more in
questions.solution: Solution:		The speed of sound is faster in solid materials and slower in liquids or gases. The velocity of a sound wave is affected by two properties of matter: the elastic properties and density.

questions.Question: Echo is heard due to
questions.solution: Solution:		An echo is a sound that is repeated because the sound waves are reflected back.

questions.Question: A person standing on a railway platform listens to the whistles of arriving and departing trains. The whistle heard is
questions.optionA: The same in both cases in all respects
questions.optionB: Of higher intensity when train arrives
questions.optionC: Of higher pitch when train arrives
questions.optionD: Of higher pitch when train departs
questions.solution: Solution:		Sound is a sequence of waves of pressure that propagates through compressible media such as air or water. (Sound can propagate through solids as well, but there are additional modes of propagation). Sound that is perceptible by humans has frequencies from about 20 Hz to 20,000 Hz. In air at standard temperature and pressure, the corresponding wavelengths of sound waves range from 17 m to 17 mm. During propagation, waves can be reflected, refracted, or attenuated by the medium. Now if we consider these cases, then the train which is arriving towards us having whistles of higher pitch because it propagates through a medium which is coming towards us but the train which is leaving propagating through a medium moving further away from the listener and thus produced whistle of lower pitch.

questions.Question: The sound produced by a bat is–
questions.solution: Solution:		The sound waves produced by the bats are ultrasonic waves. Bats emit sounds at typically 2 or 3 times higher pitch than we can hear. Sounds above human hearing are usually called ultrasonic.

questions.Question: Sound is heard over longer distances on rainy days because
questions.optionA: Sound travels slowly in moist air
questions.optionB: Sound travels faster in moist air
questions.optionC: Moist air does not absorb sound
questions.solution: Solution:		During rainy days, the moisture content is more in the atmosphere and speed or velocity of sound increases with increase in humidity. Hence the sound travels faster on rainy days.

questions.Question: If a band is played on the moon the sound will
questions.optionD: Not be heard at any distance at all from it
questions.solution: Solution:		As there is no atmosphere surrounding the moon, the sound from any band that is played there cannot travel outwards there is no material medium surrounding it for its propagation.

questions.Question: The shape of our milky way galaxy is
questions.solution: Solution:		The shape of our milky way galaxy is spiral.

questions.Question: The colours of stars depend on their
questions.solution: Solution:		Stars come in lots of different colours, and their colour depends on the temperature of the star. We find that small stars are cool (less than 3000°C) with a red-ish appearance, whereas big heavy stars are hot (over 30,000°C), and have a blue-ish glow.

questions.Question: The substance which conducts current in the solid state is
questions.solution: Solution:		One free electron is there due to which graphite conducts electricity in the solid state.

questions.Question: Electric current is measured by which instrument?
questions.solution: Solution:		The electric current in one part of a circuit is measured with an ammeter, which gives a reading in ampere.

questions.Question: A concave lens always forms an image which is
questions.solution: Solution:		A concave lens always forms an image which is virtual and erect.

questions.Question: Which one of the following determines the sharpness of image in a camera ?
questions.optionC: The focal length of the lens
questions.solution: Solution:		Image quality is a characteristic of an image that measures the perceived image degradation (typically, compared to an ideal or perfect image). Imaging systems may introduce some amounts of distortion or artifacts in the signal, so the quality assessment is an important problem. Sharpness determines the amount of detail an image can convey. System sharpness is affected by the lens (design and manufacturing quality, focal length, aperture, and distance from the image center) and sensor (pixel count and anti-aliasing filter).

questions.Question: Dioptre is the unit of
questions.solution: Solution:		Dioptere is the unit of power of a lens.

questions.Question: The part of the eye having the largest refractive index is :
questions.solution: Solution:		The part of the eye having the largest refractive index is lens.

questions.Question: Vehicles use ________ to see the objects coming from behind.
questions.solution: Solution:		Convex mirror is used as a rear view mirror in the vehicles because convex mirror always forms virtual, erect and diminished images irrespective of distance of the object. A convex mirror enables a driver to view large area of the traffic behind him.

questions.Question: Which elements are malleable and good conductors of electricity?
questions.solution: Solution:		The elements which will be malleable (thin sheets) and good conductors of electricity has to be a metal. Tin and Silver is correct answer.

questions.Question: What is the resistance (in ohm) of an electrical component if a current of 0.1 A passes through it on application of 5 V of potential difference across it?
questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: If electric resistance is to be decreased, then the number of resistances should be connected in ________
questions.solution: Solution:		Resistors are in parallel when each resistor is connected directly to the voltage source by connecting wires having negligible resistance. Each resistor thus has the full voltage of the source applied to it.When resistors are connected in parallel, more current flows from the source than would flow for any of them individually, so the total resistance is lower. Each resistor in parallel has the same full voltage of the source applied to it, but divide the total current among them.

questions.Question: Ampere second could be the unit of
questions.solution: Solution:		Ampere second could be the unit of conductance.

questions.Question: Which one of the following is a good electrical conductor?
questions.solution: Solution:		Conductivity is the capacity to transmit current or heat. Pure elemental silver is the best conductor of electricity. Copper, gold, aluminium are good conductors of electricity.

questions.Question: Which of the following terms is not used in the field of physics?
questions.solution: Solution:		Stock value is not used in the field of physics.

questions.Question: Radiocarbon is produced in the atmosphere as a result of
questions.optionA: Collision between fast neutrons and nitrogen nuclei present in the atmosphere.
questions.optionB: Action of ultraviolet light from the sun on atmospheric oxygen.
questions.optionC: Action of solar radiations particularly cosmic rays on carbon dioxide present in the atmosphere.
questions.solution: Solution:		Radiocarbon is produced in the atmosphere as result of collision between fast neutrons and nitrogen nuclei present in the atmosphere.

questions.Question: It is easier to roll a stone up a sloping road than to lift it vertical upwards because
questions.optionA: Work done in rolling is more than in lifting.
questions.optionB: Work done in lifting the stone is equal to rolling it.
questions.optionC: Work done in both is same but the rate of doing work is less in rolling.
questions.optionD: Work done in rolling a stone is less than in lifting it.
questions.solution: Solution:		It is easier to roll a stone up a sloping road than to lift it vertical upwards because work done in rolling a stone is less than in lifting it.

questions.Question: The absorption of ink by blotting paper involves:
questions.optionC: Diffusion of ink through the blotting
questions.solution: Solution:		The absorption of ink by blotting paper involves capillary action phenomenon because the blotting paper is a thin and a smooth paper which allows a little thicker liquids like ink to absorb.

questions.Question: Siphon will fail to work if:
questions.optionA: The densities of the liquid in the two vessels are equal.
questions.optionB: The level of the liquid in the two vessels are at the same height.
questions.optionC: Both its limbs are of unequal length.
questions.optionD: The temperature of the liquids in the two vessels are the same.
questions.solution: Solution:		Siphon is a tube bent to form two legs of unequal length by which a liquid can be transferred from a reservoir and then down to a lower level of it. Siphon will fail to work if, the level of the liquid in the two vessels are at the same height.

questions.Question: What is the value of 1 kW = ?
questions.solution: Solution:		1 kW = 1000 W.

questions.Question: The electric current in a metal wire is due to the flow of -
questions.solution: Solution:		The electric current in a metal wire is due to the flow of electrons.

questions.Question: An electric fuse is based on
questions.optionA: The chemical effect of the current
questions.optionB: The magnetic effect of the current
questions.optionC: The heating effect of the current
questions.solution: Solution:		The electric fuse is based on the heating effect of the current. Electric fuse have low melting point so when high current flow through fuse wire it heated and melted and break down the electric circuit.

questions.Question: Metals are good conductors of electricity because
questions.solution: Solution:		Metals are an excellent conductor of electricity and heat because the atoms in the metals form a matrix through which outer electrons can move freely. Instead of orbiting their respective atoms, they form a sea of electrons that surround the positive nuclei of the interacting metal ions.

questions.Question: Find the current (in A) when a charge of 1200C flows in 6 seconds.
questions.solution: Solution:		Current = Charge/Time I = Q/t I = 1200/6 I = 200 A.

questions.Question: We always see the same face of the moon, because
questions.optionA: It is smaller than the earth
questions.optionB: It revolves on its axis in adirection opposite to that ofthe earth
questions.optionC: It takes equal time for revolution around the earth and rotation on its own axis
questions.optionD: It rotates at the same speed as the earth around the sun
questions.solution: Solution:		The Moon does not rotate. The Moon does spin on its axis, completing a rotation once every 27.3 days; the confusion is caused because it also takes the same period to orbit the Earth, so that it keeps the same side facing us.

questions.Question: The fact that the planets move around the Sun, not in circles but in ellipses, was first demonstrated by
questions.solution: Solution:		The fact that the planets move around the Sun, not in circles but in ellipses, was first demonstrated by Johannes Kepler.

questions.Question: A bomb explodes on the moon. You will hear its sound on earth after ________
questions.optionD: You cannot hear the sound of explosion
questions.solution: Solution:		As sound is produced due to vibrations in the medium particle, that is, it needs some medium for propagation and moon does not have any atmosphere. So ultimately, no medium for propagation of waves or vibrations of a medium particle.

questions.Question: Stars are held together by
questions.solution: Solution:		A star is a sphere of gas held together by its own gravity. The closest star to Earth is our very own Sun, so we have an example nearby that astronomers can study in detail.

questions.Question: The minimum number of geostationary satellites needed for uninterrupted global coverage is :
questions.solution: Solution:		In theory, 2 satellites in diametrically opposite geosynchronous orbits could cover the planet. In order for the satellites to communicate, a minimum of 3 would be needed, each at a 60 degree angle to the others. At this point, the strength and quality of coverage increases proportionally to the number of satellites.

questions.Question: An object at rest may have
questions.solution: Solution:		An object at rest may have Potential energy.

questions.Question: Which conservation principle is applicable in the case of the motion of a rocket?
questions.solution: Solution:		Rocket works on the principle of conservation of momentum. Rocket ejaculates gases in backward direction which creates momentum of the gases backwards and thus by conservation of momentum, the rocket gets a momentum in the forward direction making it to move forward.

questions.Question: Rocket works on the principle of
questions.solution: Solution:		Rocket works on the principle of Newton's Third Law.

questions.Question: A passenger standing in a bus is thrown outward when the bus takes a sudden turn. This happens due to
questions.solution: Solution:		Newton's 1st law of inertia states that an object will change its direction when a force is applied to it. Hence, when a bus takes a sudden turn the passengers are thrown outward. This is due to the inertia of direction.

questions.Question: When a running car stops suddenly, the passengers tends to lean forward because of:
questions.solution: Solution:		When a running car stops suddenly, the passenger tends to lean forward because of inertia of motion. according to Newton's 1st law of motion, every bodies have nature to maintain inertia of rest or motion until there is no net force applied on that body.

questions.Question: Fish and other aquatic creatures can live inside a deep frozen pond because
questions.optionB: Ice is a bad conductor of heat
questions.optionC: There will always be water just beneath the ice level
questions.optionD: They can adapt themselves to live in ice
questions.solution: Solution:		All liquids have a boiling point and a freezing point. Underneath the frozen upper layer, the water remains in its liquid form and does not freeze. Also, oxygen is trapped beneath the layer of ice. As a result, fish and other aquatic animals find it possible to live comfortably in the frozen lakes and ponds.

questions.Question: The density of a gas is maximum at
questions.solution: Solution:		The density of gases depends upon the temperature. The higher the temperature, the more the molecules are spread out and the lower the density.

questions.Question: Lakes freeze in cold countries in winter, leaving the water underneath at
questions.solution: Solution:		Freezing takes place at he top of the lake this is because water colder than 4 degree celsius usually starts to expand and get less dense as it gets colder. It is the liquid with more density that settles at the bottom while the less denser floats above it.

questions.Question: A bimetal made copper and iron strips welded together is straight at room temperature. It is held vertically with iron strip towards left and copper strip towards right. If this bimetal is heated, it will
questions.solution: Solution:		Since the strips are welded together, the combined strip will bend towards left ( towards iron ) since copper strip will have more length than the iron strip.

questions.Question: Thermal expansion of materials arises from
questions.solution: Solution:		Thermal expansion of materials arises from asymmetry of potential energy curve.

questions.Question: During hot weather, the fan produces a feeling of comfort. This is because
questions.solution: Solution:		During hot weather, the fan produces a feeling of comfort. This is because our perspiration evaporates rapidly.

questions.Question: The flow of thermal energy is called
questions.solution: Solution:		The term conduction refers to the transfer of energy. Conduction occurs when energy is passed between objects. The transfer of thermal energy is called heat.

questions.Question: On a cold day when the room temperature is 15°C, the metallic cap of a pen becomes much colder than its plastic body, though both are at the same temperature of 15°C, because :
questions.optionA: Metals have higher thermal capacity than plastics
questions.optionB: Plastics have a lower density than metals
questions.optionC: Metals are good conductors of heat
questions.optionD: Plastics have a higher thermal conductivity than metals
questions.solution: Solution:		On a cold day when the room temperature is 15°C, the metallic cap of a pen becomes much colder than its plastic body, though both are at the same temperature of 15°C, because metals are good conductors of heat.

questions.Question: Which of the following is an insulator?
questions.solution: Solution:		Glass is an insulator.

questions.Question: 'Therm' is the unit of
questions.solution: Solution:		'Therm' is the unit of heat.

questions.Question: The surface tension of water on adding detergent to it
questions.solution: Solution:		When detergent is added to water, it decreases the surface tension of the water. Compounds that lower water's surface tension are called surfactants, which work by separating the water molecules from one another.

questions.Question: A bottle of sodalime is grasped by the neck and swung briskly in a vertical circle, Near which portion of the bottle do the bubbles collect?
questions.optionB: In the middle of the bottom
questions.solution: Solution:		Due to the lightness of the gas bubble they feel less centrifugal force so they get collected near the neck of the bottle. They collect near the center of circular motion i.e. near the neck of the bottle.

questions.Question: Which liquid is the most viscous?
questions.solution: Solution:		A fluid with large viscosity hinders motion because its molecular makeup gives it a lot of internal friction. Oil is the most viscous amongst all the option.

questions.Question: Rain drops acquire spherical shape due to
questions.solution: Solution:		Raindrops start to form in a roughly spherical structure due to the surface tension of water. This surface tension is the "skin" of a body of water that makes the molecules stick together. The cause is the weak hydrogen bonds that occur between water molecules.

questions.Question: The fact that two large ships travelling on close parallel courses in the same direction tend to move towards each other can be explained by
questions.optionB: Magnetic properties of the ship's material
questions.solution: Solution:		The fact that two large ships travelling on close parallel courses in the same direction tend to move towards each other can be explained by Bernoulli's principle. The rapid flow of air between the two moving ships causes a reducton of pressure (Bernoulli's principle) , so they (the ships) are drawn closer together.

questions.Question: The sudden fall of atmospheric pressure indicates
questions.solution: Solution:		A slowly rising atmospheric pressure, over a week or two, typically indicates settled weather that will last a long time. A sudden drop in atmospheric pressure over a few hours often forecasts an approaching storm, with heavy rain and strong winds.

questions.Question: Hydraulic brakes in automobile work on
questions.solution: Solution:		Hydraulic brakes in automobile work on Pascal's principle.

questions.Question: When the barometer reading dips suddenly, it is an indication of
questions.solution: Solution:		When the barometer reading dips suddenly, it is an indication of storm.

questions.Question: A storm is predicted if atmospheric pressure
questions.solution: Solution:		A storm is predicted if atmospheric pressure falls suddenly.

questions.Question: On which principle does the hydraulic lift works?
questions.solution: Solution:		Hydraulic lift works on the principle of Pascal's law.

questions.Question: Echolocation is an adaptation bats use to
questions.solution: Solution:		Echolocation is an adaptation bats use to locate flowering plants, hunt insects in flight and find warm places for hibernation.

questions.Question: Bats can sense obstacles because they produce
questions.solution: Solution:		Bats are capable of avoiding obstacles that they encounter, even in complete darkness. This is because they emit ultrasound (high frequency sound) and analyse the echo produced when the sound hits objects on their path. Prey capture without the aid of echolocation by some bats is also described.

questions.Question: A wavelength of 0.3 m is produced in air and it travels at a speed of 300 m/s. Then it will be an
questions.solution: Solution:		The formula of frequency is: f = c / ë = wave speed c (m/s) / wavelength ë (m), where f: frequency, c: wave speed, and ë: wavelength. As per the question, f = 300/0.3 = 1000 cycles/ seconds = 1000 Hz = 1 KHz. Sound waves with frequencies above 20 KHz are called Ultrasonic; those below 20 Hz are called Infrasonic. Sound waves with frequencies between 20 Hz to 20,000 Hz are called audible waves.

questions.Question: Which term is not associated with sound wave?
questions.solution: Solution:		Candela is the SI unit of luminous intensity.

questions.Question: Velocity of sound in air does not depend on
questions.solution: Solution:		Assuming air to be an ideal gas, the speed of sound depends on temperature only. As air temperature increases, so does the speed of sound and vice versa. The speed of sound is completely independent of air pressure because the air pressure and air density are proportional to each other at the same temperature.

questions.Question: Anemometer is an instrument meant for measuring ________
